text:
Ok been waiting to get home to write this.

Me and my wife and youngest daughter were staying at the Fremont Hotel and decided on eating there as well.  We went down stairs and walked into the Paradise Buffet, my wife asked the cashier how much for my 6 year old and she informed her it would be full price, without my wife even asking the cashier took it upon herself to waive the cost for my daughter, all 36lbs of her.  She even cleared it with a male manager.

We proceeded to be seated close to the buffet which was nice since I was hobbling already from over doing it walking on the strip earlier that evening.  As soon as our waiter came by he asked about drinks I told him 3, he asked how many we're eating and I again said 3.  He looked at the receipt and noticed we payed for 2.  I told him what the cashier had done and he said ok and walked away.

5 minutes later a female manager walked over and told me we would have to pay the $17.99 for my daughter to eat.  I said I would talk to my wife and we would handle it, she said ok and left.  Our waiter, who clearly must have ownership in the buffet came by again and was looking for the receipt that we paid for my daughter, I told him we had not yet, at that time my wife came to the table and informed him that the male manager had approved it, our waiter/owner said the manager has no right to approve, such a drain on the business and cash income of such a struggling establishment, ok he just said the manager had no right to approve that.

So now our appetite is ruined, we are pissed and I want to kill our self important arrogant bastard of a waiter.  But after he and his favorite manager went and spoke with the original manager, who apparently COULD approve such a thing, they dropped it and left us alone.

The food was ok, not great.  The service was ..... Well let's just say this, never never never never again.

Well.... Where to start???? I was on Fremont street for the Year of the snake celebration events and I was hungry.... I took a walk from the stage and found myself lost in a different time zone.... Did I fall through a time rift that brought me back to the early 80's hmmmm...... I like the music and the TV shows were great but I digress.

No time rift no alternate universe on Fremont Street.... Nope I was in the Paradise Buffet... A look back into a culinary error (sorry mean to say ERA) that has long past on the Vegas strip but is alive and well in on Fremont Street. 

Atmosphere- Interesting if you like that vintage diner feel... (yes plastic flowers and all)

Service- Great!!! Our server was right there as soon as I put down my fork or hit the bottom of my glass with the the following line " Go get some more" and "Let me refill that for you" The Hawaiian shirts and the flowers in the hair I guess you can compare to "flare" that you see at other restaurants but it just fit right in with everything else. 

Food- Ummm hmmmmm well It was ummm homey and not in a bad way the items on the buffet were ALL very identifiable from the iceberg lettuce salad (really) to the cold cuts (really really) to the make your own taco station. You knew what you were getting yourself into from a culinary standpoint and did not have to ask any question about what an item was. More then likely you have had it a few nights ago for dinner. 

All in all great place to sit relax and enjoy some comfort buffet food that you WONT see on the Vegas strip... ANYWHERE and that is not a bad thing.
I came here for steak night and it was great. However the lines are long. The rest of food, I don't remember because I mostly ate steaks. I would come here again just for Steak Night.

Mediocre buffet, food was very basic, nothing stood out in taste or presentation. Our server brought us waters and we never saw him again. We thought it would be good based on the lineup but it must just be the location that makes it so busy- not worth it at all!

When was the last time I was in Vegas? Yesterday!  Had dinner in the Paradise Buffet in the Fremont Hotel.  Cheap eats caught my attention.  Buffet with NY Steak cooked to order.  Hey, why not!  6:30pm and there just a couple people ahead of me to pay before entering.  It felt like I was lining up on the cafeteria line back in the days of elementary school.  But can't go wrong with a $26 dinner for two.  
Endulge....all you can eat!  Went straight for the roast beef roast and mash potatoes.  Not bad.  They advertised sushi but it was only limited to tuna rolls (small strand of tuna surrounded with rice and wrapped in seaweed) - California rolls (Not good at all) - Somesorta roll (didn't know what it was but didn't take anyway and the shrimp nigiri.  Overall selection was not good for sushi.  New York Steak - 6 oz Grilled to medium rare.  The chef cooking it was more entertaining than the steak.   Crab legs were good.  Not the biggest but they were good.  The selections were good for the price.  Gotta love the soft serve ice cream.  This was not bad tasting considering I've tried some that just tasted like frozen milk.  I was too stuffed that I didn't get to try the Tacos, duck, and hot food items.  Salad bar was decent.  Dessert selection was okay with the different pies and cakes.  And the slices were sizely okay.  If you want to stuff yourself with a budget......go.  Don't expect much from though and you'll enjoy the experience.  The filipino servers were on top of their service with following up on drink re-fills even though I didn't need one, pre-bussing and extra napkins.  Would I go back?  Maybe not considering I have to experience all the other buffets in Vegas.

This buffet has really gone down hill. At least for lunch. Food that was suppose to be hot was cold to room temperature. Very poor choice of food and it looked as if it had been sitting out for hours.It was not appetizing and I had a stomach ache for hours.

The wife and I went there for Prime Rib Night for 17.99 and on top of that I had a two for one Fremont St. coupon, Can you beat that!  The restaurant has a cozy dim atmosphere which made it seem less like a buffet.  We could eat and talk, it was very relaxing.  

The food was of your standard buffet selection but the prime rib was really good.  I will definitely  come back on my next trip.
Food is consistent always good reasonable price. Good value great salad Would recommend Seafood on weekends would wait for that in my opinion.
Not fresh, little variety, typical buffet cost for a dismal little meal.

As I remembered from the last 20 years I been coming here staff always greets you with a smile, is very kind and helpful. 
Our first 4 days this worker Luke looks as if he is upset does not greet you, does not smile, have no customer satisfaction servicing skills. I requested to have our party seated on the left were we have been placed everytime we came to eat. He tells me there is no table, I look in the section on the left there are many tables open.  As I leave the restraunt his staff does not even say thank but tells all the other customers leaving after me thank you. Its sad to see the same faces there for many years and you have this one worker that just makes it look bad.
Otherwise the other staffs are smiling, friendly, kind and helpful.
Great food!!! Wednesday is all you can eat steak buffet for 13.99. Fantastic selection of food!!  Nice atmosphere.  Gives that old Vegas feel.

So much fun... Come in when they have their seafood buffet. Bring some drunken friends and have a blast... Don't get me wrong, the food is horrible, but if you're looking for an old school, fear and loathing type experience, this is the spot.

I went to this buffet for breakfast. Compared to the other buffets I was able to go to while on the Strip I found it to be really lacking in selection. For the price, I really was not impressed. The only thing that made it a little better was the bottomless mimosas.
it was a brunch and it was taste less and it made me a little sich so not a fan wont be back!

We tried this out on a Friday seafood night. $22.95 per person.
Very disappointing.
The food selection was very small, and very average.
Nothing was very good, at best it was generic and at worst overcooked and blah.
Lots of desserts, acceptable but nothing exceptional.
Disappointing introduction to Vegas buffets.
My wife says, avoid the sushi, it's flavorless.

Definitely not one of the best buffets I have ever been to. But, my parents really wanted to for the AYCE crab legs & shrimp, AKA seafood night on Tuesday's, so I had to humor them while they were in town for a visit. My Aunt & Uncle who were also in town played it a little smarter & went to Hash House at the Plaza :P 

The place as a whole is a little depressing & the selection was just ok. I'm not usually a fan of snow crab legs, just because I feel the reward is not worth the effort of sitting there & trying to crack them open. However, I was mildly impressed by the fact that the legs here are already split for you & ready to go. Wow! And...they actually tasted petty good. I tried both the cold & the steamed...pretty tasty. 

I wasn't very happy with the shrimp though, They were really bland & not even lemon juice, butter, and cocktail sauce could help :( 

Also, we had a really bad waiter & I had no compassion for the fact that he was an old man. I really wanted to sock this guy in the head! & I will just leave it at that. 

The 2 stars is actually pretty generous, but I have to give it to them for splitting the legs for you already. 

Would I come back? Hmm...I think the jury is still out on that one.
This place is nasty as fuck the food is dry and the selection is soooo small don't waste your money and time if I could give it zero stars I would!!!!

My wife and I were at Paradise buffet last Saturday for lunch. 
Assume for a moment there are 1000 restaurants in Las Vegas that offer buffets -- then I would rate Paradise 1001. The dining area is fine. The food stations are neat and tidy, but the food selections are very poor and limited (seafood practically non-existent). The dishes offered taste from awful to poor. Would recommend anywhere else for your meal other than this buffet.

Zero star!!!!  The lady who served us, Cora, was a hot mess!  She was too busy serving other section that does not belong to her then to concentrate on her customers.  Took her forever to bring a cup of coffee and when she came by with the coffee pot, she dripped the coffee on my pants.  Seriously?!?!  Not on top of my fav list in Vegas.

I was staying in downtown Vegas for a night and my family friend claimed this buffet restaurant was the best in that area (as they recalled 10 years ago). There was no way I was going to drive or bus to the main strip for dinner, and I settled for this--which was a big mistake. I went on a Thursday night so there was no "Seafood buffet", however, there were crab claws, smoked salmon, and various choices of meat...which were questionable. As a sushi fan, I looked forward to the sushi, but was disappointed as they were the same quality as the pre-packaged sushi found in the supermarkets. The salad choices, or lack thereof, were extremely mediocre and so were the choices in fruits. In the middle of my dinner my stomach started rumbling which is a huge red flag to stop eating, so I did. However, I was sad that I did not get to try the some-what delicious-looking dessert collection, but I am pretty sure I would have been disappointed. The two stars are for the price ($9.99) and the quick seating service (which could be explained by the lack of people that were there). Definitely opt for a better buffet place or Tony Roma's which is next door.

My husband and I arrived for the breakfast buffet at 10 am and asked if they were still serving breakfast. They were so we paid $23.00 for 2 buffets, not a bad price, but the food was horrible! A very limited selection and we were only there about 10 min when they started closing for lunch. That would have been useful info before we paid!

The Paradise Buffet is a nice small, inexpensive buffet on Fremont Street at the Fremont Hotel & Casino. I was not very impressed with the decor. It is like sitting in the middle of a jungle. It is quite bright in a colorful way. A bit on the gaudy side to me. But I look forward to going back again. There are a few things there that make me say that. First of all was the service. I sat down and within moments someone came by to take my drink order. When I sat back down after getting my first plate my beverage was there and the glass never went empty. I don't mean that I didn't drink much. I mean that before my glass went empty each time a new glass was brought to may table. Every time I finished a plate, cup, or bowl within moments of me setting it aside it was whisked away. I am very surprised that for a small hotel buffet the service ranks as high as some high priced restaurants I have been in.

Another thing that surprised me was the quality of the food. I was not expecting such good food. The buffet is not very big but what they have is big on flavor. The roast beef was succulent and had a flavor that lets you know what a good beef tastes like. It was also very low in the fat department. I have been to some places where their beef was fatty and just ruined the meat. The Mexican lasagna was one of the best low cost dishes I have ever had. I am quite impressed with the food quality. I do see myself going back again.

I checked Vegas review and decided to try this brunch buffet on Sunday. It is about 15 min driving on I-15 from where I stayed. The hotel only has valet parking. The buffet area is decorated like tropical rain forest, though a bit dark. Crowded in the late morning. Food was not bad but not that impressive either. The waiter was okay but kind of slow for my table (just myself, so didn't get his attention too much). I liked the sausage they have. It reminded me of my childhood. If you want to experience Fremont, this place is a choice. After brunch, I played slot machine at their casino. I was lucky enough to get my money back :)

Went here for breakfast. All was good except our server lady named Virgy. She had the worst service/people skills. But besides her terrible attitude the rest of the staff was nice and positive. We probably be coming back though.
This place was great!  food is really tasty and staff is very attentive. Ramon, whom we had the pleasure of serving us,  never let our champagne run dry!

Went here last Saturday for breakfast.  We got there just in time.  Right after we made our first round through, the line to get in was growing long.  When we arrived, we walked right up to the cashier.  Lucky us!   First off, my hubby is stoked that there was seafood everywhere!  Crab for breakfast?  If you insist.  Plus all the regular fixins.  Plus they had some lunch/dinner items out as well.  The fried chicken looked good, but I did not try it since I wanted breakfast food and I don't do chicken for breakfast! Everything was good.  The yams sounded good, but were a mistake.  They were not cut right, I ended up with an end piece still on the yam.  But other than that they tasted pretty good.  Waitress was very attentive.  Our glasses were never empty.  
If you are not looking for gourmet type faire and are not wanting to spend a fortune,  come here.  If you want a fancy atmosphere with extravagant names for your food, then go to a buffet on the strip.  
This place fills you up for cheap.  Go and sign up for the Byods card.  You get discounts at the buffet here and at the other Byod casinos in Vegas.

I was a little hesitant about coming to the paradise buffet based on the mix reviews but my wife and I. Did not feel like driving since we were staying downtown we gave it a try our server Matilda was amazing never had an empty drink or a dirty dish on our table and as for the food I did not have anything on my plate that I did not 
like the fried chicken was perfectly crisp and the breaded shrimp wow as for the price you can't beat it tried other buffets at the larger casinos and they didn't come  close

Kinda like Home Town Buffet.

15 a person on steak night. A dollar less with your club card. Not bad but not great.

The Paradise buffet offered a nice selection for the price at just $7.99 unless you have a players club card then you receive $1.00 discount. 
The venue sticks with the theme of its name and has a great tropical feel to it. I would highly recommend the omlet bar and fresh made pancakes. Both were delicious and they do have egg whites available for omlets.
Our server was attentive and kept the table clear and the drinks coming.

Gross! Reminded me of school cafeteria food. I had to get full off of mashed potatoes and gravy. My husband could only eat the french fries and bacon. Honestly the worst food that I have had in Vegas so far.
Plus side is-its cheap. You get what you pay for.

Food is good.   The staff is very friendly and super at tentative.    It's in Old town Vegas so don't expect Strip decor.   It's old school Vegas.   They have a variety of entrees at affordable prices.  Go early.    They serve Shrimp and Crab legs on Tuesday;  steak on Wednesday and Prime rib on Thursday.    Brunch Saturday's and Sundays.

As far was Vegas buffets go you will hear fancy hotel names, but your wallet will feel the punch.  Since my hubby and I have discovered the Paradise Buffet @ the Fremont we are sold!!!  The service is always good, the food is always more than satisfactory, and the value will leave you feeling great!! In fact on our last trip this buffet trumped the Bellagio hands down (over salty, cold crab legs? no thank you).  We came here for brunch on a Saturday morning and there was no lineup.  It includes "Champagne"--some fizzy stuff which I didn't end up getting (you actually have to ask for it even though it's included and unlimited) which makes $10.99 (with their free players card) a great deal.  I had tea instead, which was good.  

Brunch included stone crab (better than the crap @ the Bellagio), prime rib (not bad), and white rice (for some reason I crave this stuff when I go away).  Lots of breakfast items like sauteed sausage with onions and other fare. I left stuffed and so happy!!  Dinner is good value and tasty as well!

Food is ok.
Price is fair.
Choices are decent. 
But the only down side is they do not support veterans. Everywhere else in Vegas does support vets but this place... 
I would give more stars if they would.

We thought we should try a buffet since they are supposed to be great here.  Not so much.  I have had better food at country buffet, which is boring.

The staff seemed to not care about helping you, the place was dirty.  The seafood was very bland as well as the other food.  I don't think I will ever go back.  
If you are in search of a good buffet near Fremont street, keep looking.  Your stomach will thank you.

This place is a CLASSIC! the interior - TIME MACHINE! Relax and enjoy a meal in the 1970's -  it's OLD SCHOOL! 

For TBG a MUST visit when in Vegas! Food is great - selection good -  price fair - staff friendly.
price/dining experience ratio: Awesome!

Came on a Saturday at 2:30. Pretty much only breakfast and desserts available. Chuck-a-rama has a much better selection and better tasting food. Cheaper too. Food was very bland. Will not be returning!

One Friday evening many years ago my wife and I stumbled upon the Paradise Buffet at the Fremont Casino. Being seafood lovers, we really enjoy their seafood buffet (Tuesdays and Fridays). Every time we're in Las Vegas, we make a point to visit Fremont Street Friday evening so that we can eat here. 

In addition to the usual buffet items, the seafood buffet includes boiled shrimp (both peeled and still in the shell -- go for the latter), crab legs, oysters, smoked salmon and more.

Yum - Oxtail for the win!  The man and I wanted to try their oxtail to compare to the California Hotel, Market Cafe Oxtail. I love that Paradise serves it all day (instead of waiting for 11pm) but it is different, the Market Cafe one has carrots and celery, the Paradise one has water chestnuts and shiitake mushrooms.  You also get the choice of rice or ramen to go with. We choose ramen and it was yummy. It had a rich flavorful broth and melt in your mouth oxtail.  IT is definitely on my Vegas "hit list".

Ok I honestly dont know what people are eating there but this place is not good at all. We went there mainly because of the reviews here. 

First of all I asked for a med rare cut of the prime rib but the whole thing was cooked well done throughout. I figured since it might have been an old piece so I went back when they put out a new one and asked for another med rare piece. The carver was trying to show the person there where to cut for the raw slice and when he cut it down the middle it was well done again. Chicken was dry, pasta was soggy, and nothing looked appealing. 

The waiters were all rude and mumbled throughout the time we were there. The jungle atmosphere wasn't attractive either. Yes the buffet is cheap but expect less than what you're paying for.

this buffet is excellent and has an excellent staff.....when we first arrived in Las Vegas, one of our plans was to hit a champagne brunch while waiting to check in....im glad we picked the Paradise Buffet.....great brunch with a bottomless glass of champagne...i left full AND a little buzzed...the carving stations had glorious roast meats and the omelette and pancake/waffle station was so good....they have a lot of different foods and good soups....this place is great for lunch to, with different things daily...one day they had French Onion Soup...wow....this place is great and the drink service is fast and seems to be psychic...they always kept the drinks coming....great food and staff...if you stay downtown,this is the place to fuel up for a days worth of Las vegas revelry....

I was in vegas for 5 days and ate here every day...thats how good it was! Price very reasonable. Food quality very good generally...with just a few misses, but thats what you get at a buffet. Seafood buffet is not to be missed, had it twice! Steak night...loved it! Ate at the breakfast buffet...cooked my omelet just like i wanted it and i am picky. Prime rib night was just ok. I ate at the Tony Roma's for prime rib and loved it. However, bottom line 5 stars.
Horrible food horrible service I wish I would have went somewhere else they didn't clean our table some crab legs were sour I got sick afterwards just bad food

The buffet I recommend is the Friday night seafood which is $16.99+tax drink included.  It has all the stuff you'd expect of a downtown Vegas buffet including shrimp cocktail, smoked salmon, snow crab legs, half shell oysters, prime rib, etc etc etc.. (prime rib was overcooked and tough so make sure you look at the color and how many strokes it takes the carver to cut your slice).  Good salad bar.  Desserts are okay.

Food taste and quality is definitely 3 stars but overall it is a good deal and has lots of selections.  In my opinion having fancy seafood is not an indication of culinary skill, though it is a must have for a buffet of this caliber.  (It isn't hard to thaw a couple cases of precooked split crab legs or to blanch and shock a couple hundred pounds of shrimp in a steam kettle for shrimp cocktail.)  

Ambiance is festive and fun, but verges on tacky with its plastic flower tropical theme.  Its a turn and burn buffet so don't expect much service so i'm not going to even rate that aspect here.

If you're hungry on a Friday night and happen to be checking the FSE out, definitely stop by and try it out!

FOOD POISIONING WARNING We went for "prime rib" night. The food selection was so small. The staff that served the meat yelled at someone "what do you want? Pick what you want!" But that is not why I am giving it such a low score. My husband got food poisioning from the chicken in the Italian section he saw that it was pink so he stopped eating it but that ruined our whole trip. Having to stay in our hotel room because he couldn't leave the bed. Way to go Fremont hotel. Never again.

I visited this buffet with a coworker during CES week, doing our annual ritual of having at least one casual buffet at Vegas. This came up on Google search as a good inexpensive buffet but it's a pure lie. The food was terrible beyond words.

Absolutely nothing tasted good or was decently cooked, except the taco station. Everything was either bland or tasted like salt bomb. Most items are over cooked and dry.

I saw a coupe of young guys came in and sat at the table next to us. They looked hungry and could enjoy a few plate worth of food, but they left after a few bites into the first plate!!! On the way out, they complained how terrible the food was.

Skip this place - the food is so terrible it's not excusable for Las Vegas, especially at this crazy high price.

I read in a book "Prisoons: Prison Cartoons" that this was the best prime rib in Vegas and at an excellent price and I am so glad we came here. My girl and I loved it. Best deal in Las Vegas. Got full but still had a great time doing the Fremont Street Experience. Love this town.

Good food for a great price? I'm there! Is it just me or is Vegas just full of buffets? Anyways, wear your elastic-waisted pants. Don't say I didn't warn you. The buffet is a bit small, but it gets the job done. The best buffet crab legs I've ever had. The staff are always eager to refill our drinks and take away our plates. Food gets replaced VERY often, so the food is always fresh. 

Final Verdict: A good buffet at a really good price, I love that the staff is so friendly and nice! Grub is yummy for buffet type food, it puts me in a very good mood!

First off, you can't be comparing this seafood buffet to the twice the price ones.  This seafood buffet has many selections of seafood.  I really like the snow crab as it has been cut in half so there is no shucking to do.  I usually get my fill of this & then go to the warm station for fried squid, oysters, shrimp.  There is also grilled salmon and mahi mahi.  For the price of 17.99 the foods tastes good, the atmosphere is great,  reminiscent of old Vegas, and the waiters are excellent.  We pay with our points & it is a really enjoyable evening out.

it wasn't bad for the price ($17/person). the mashed potatoes needed milk/cream as they were too stiff, the kung pao chicken was horrible; however, i did enjoy the sushi and the boneless chicken patties, as they were flavored well. the staff were pretty friendly, but the d√©cor was sorta cheesy. the whole time i was there i was thinking Vegas Vacation; you know, the scene where Chevy Chase and Randy Quaid hit-up the buffet...it wasn't that bad, haha. I will say this was much better than the Treasure Island Buffet that was $30/person back in 2012.

Awesome selection of meats, chicken, pasta, seafood, sushi, Chinese, Mexican, dessert. I had a little taste of everything, I don't do buffets but I love prime rib and for the price of $15.99 per person for dinner this was a great buy. Everything tastes great cooked perfectly they were constantly putting out fresh food. 

The dinner plates were all warm, the food was hot, the salad plates were not hot , the salad was cold, the sushi was cold and kept on ice it wasn't over stocked either. 
The staff was all friendly and helpful, everyone had smiles on their face, it was a very clean establishment. Kids were welcomed too, very affordable to take the family for a night out. 

I highly recommend this establishment if you love buffets and if they aren't your thing give this one a try you'll enjoy it like I did.

Disappointed for the fact we were visiting and decided to have lunch stopped in paradise buffet wasn't told that the brunch ended in 15 minutes after arriving we sat got our drinks and got our first place mind you since it was about to end there was very little selection and our new server (switch change) came in rudely saying we can now only get dessert since brunch is over I asked to speak to management and the manager blonde lady didn't get her name offered us to stay 30 min into dinner time honestly at this point I didn't bother getting upset anymore because myself and our children were already hungry we decided to grab dessert and leave overall food is ok like they say you get what you pay for!!!  Definitely not coming back no communication between employees and customers.. Plus hearing staff dispute two tables down about duties is so unprofessional. Wouldn't recommend it unless u are super hungry on Fremont or on a budget..

The steak served on steak night was way below average. The roast beef on the carving station was much better. Decent fried chicken and salad bar. Pretty much what you would expect from a typical buffet.

On our last night in Vegas, we decided to stay downtown and try one of the buffets in the area so we ended up at the Paradise Buffet.  For $9.99/person for the "regular" buffet Monday - Thursday, it was really pretty good.  The decor is very casino-ish, but they try to make it seem more tropical with fake palm trees and flowers and everything.  It doesn't look too bad inside though.  And there are a lot of different varieties of food to try.  My dinner companion was a little upset though that they didn't have much in the way of cooked vegetables.  For a buffet downtown, this one is pretty good.

This buffet sucks!!! It was so disappointing and a huge let down. The prime rib was like chewing rubber. The A-1 was watered down. Don't go here. You're better off eating   at McDonald's! Don't waste your money, time or expectations! There was only two small lanes of nasty cheap food! What kind of buffet is that? Effen sucks major!

Well, it's not quite as cheap as it used to be, but you can't complain about $60 for a family of four with this kind of variety.   We were just so totally full of everything you can imagine, from crab legs to California "sushi" rolls.   And god there were some pigs in there.   I watched one dude literally take the entire plate of sushi rolls (like about 30 pieces) and I was thinking like "Dude, WTF!"    Hahah!     I hope he ate all of that.   I did keep watching him and he was making very good progress.   At least he BETTER have eaten all of it after making everyone else wait for more.   

I accidentally hit some lady in the head with a flying crab leg.  When I was cracking it, the thing slipped out of my hand, flew clean over the next table and hit some lady right in the noggin.   That was so embarrassing and while I am sure the people had to have noticed, they were polite and acted like nothing happened.    So what happens next?   My brother does the same thing, flying crab leg right into a mans lap at the table next to us.   That one did spurn a dirty look.   We are not normally that sloppy, we were just having an off day.   :)  

You can expect a line here, our wait was about 20 minute yet very well worth it.

The food was okay...the snow crab and shrimp was plentiful and tasty.  The service was EXCELLENT...our waiter cheerfully cleaned up a soda spill at an adjacent table, and he did it quickly and professionally.

On Wednesdays if you're 50+ and accumulate 100 or points from gambling, which is easy to do, and the buffet is free. It's steak night on Wednesdays and the cook manning the grill is friendly and will serve it to you the way you want it. It's pretty much an average buffet, they have peel and eat shrimp, crab legs but surprisingly they have some of the best fried chicken at a buffet I've ever had.

Pros:
Inexpensive.
Nice decor.
LOTS of Shrimp.
Better than the majority of the ungodly terrible buffets of Fremont St.
There's never much of a line.

Cons:
The room is weird, why are the buffet and cafe attached?
There really isn't ever a whole lot going on. Very average, traditional American food. I would have at least expected some Hawaiian offerings seeing how popular the place is with Hawaiians.

I would only recommend this buffet if you had an insatiable taste for something overwhelmingly average. If not, you can do much better.

If this is what paradise is like, I think I'll stick with normal life.

The Paradise Buffet at the Flamingo Casino and Hotel is one of the most sorry excuses for a buffet and the second-worst buffet I have eaten at in Las Vegas.

The buffet is hard to find, hard to get to, the selection is limited and the food just isn't good. While most buffets in Vegas pride themselves on seafood, the Paradise Buffet had very little of it.  

The center portion of the buffet is dedicated to shrimp cocktail and crab legs, but unlike the Aria Buffet or other top venues, the crab legs are not cracked open. This buffet also has some sushi, but it is dry and had been sitting out for a while. The sushi selection was also very limited and was the worst I have had in Las Vegas.

The rest of the buffet was nothing more than home cooked items like pot roast, macaroni and cheese, Caesar salad and boneless chicken. It was almost like an expensive, glorified Old Country Buffet. But at least with OCB, you didn't have to pay like $20.

Of course, if you check-in on Foursquare you can save a few bucks on the buffet. But it is Vegas, and who wants to stand in line to save money on a buffet. Just put that five bucks into the machine instead and let it ride.

Best bet: Skip this buffet and visit the Flamingo to just see the flamingos outside.

Ate here twice for the breakfast buffet. The food was average at best but great for the price. Made to order eggs or omelettes were decent enough. Bacon was not crispy but that's my preference. Service was 4 star. If you're staying on Fremont then go for it.

Hey, it's a cheap buffet on Fremont Street--what do you want? The salad bar was paltry, but who goes to a cheap buffet for salad (besides me?). They had good mashed taters, and a decent roast. The clam chowder was gross, though. There was a Mexican portion of the buffet, which I enjoyed and was decent (and I'm from California, so it's pretty hard to impress me with Mexican food!) I'd go back.

Compared with their newer brethren on the Strip, I've never been overwhelmed by the buffet offerings on this side of town and I'm afraid Paradise (ironically named) falls neatly under this description.  We visited on a Wednesday evening and the line was about 10 - 15 minutes long.  Then the price reminded us why we tried a buffet in the Fremont.  $35 for two!  These days the price for one is more than that in places like Bellagio and Caesar's Palace.  Everyone there from the register to table are nice folks that keep your drinks full and the table cleared.  

Sure you saw this one coming, but come for the bulk, not the quality.  I sampled the shrimp pasta in cream sauce, the roast beef, fried chicken and some stir fried vegetables from the Chinese station.  It was steak night but I didn't like the look of the steaks they cook up in the center station weirdly next to the desserts which is also oddly where they put out sushi.  Pasta was meh.  Vegetables were meh.  Fried chicken was unbearably salty so I just ate the breast meat which was dry but I hate wasting.  Roast beef from the carving station is tasty!  If I hadn't discovered the chilled peel and eat shrimp and had three plates of those, I would have gotten a slice of my own.  They marinate the shrimp in bay spices and just enough brine to flavor them.  Squeeze three wedges of lemon on those and I'm in heaven!  I ate my money's worth and left just the right level of full.  

Would I return?  Only if I happened to be on that side of town at the right time.  Otherwise, I'd still say the more exotic buffets are worth it even for more money.

I would have given 3 1/2 stars if I could only for the overall quality of the food offerings.

We ended up here on Tuesday night for seafood night.  It's a bit pricey, $27.99 for 1 person, but there really is a lot to choose from.

Let me just bullet point it here:

1) sushi should have been set it with fewer pieces so the rice wouldn't be as dried out as it was.

2) salad bar seemed fresh enough but I didn't even bother with that...had to leave room for everything else 

3) cold bar had oysters, crab, peel and eat shrimp, and a few other items I wasn't sure about. The shrimp were good even though I had to peel them.

4) hot bar was another story. Pasta (didn't have any), ribs (pretty tasty and adequate meat), crab (yummy but it would have been nice if they were at least pre cracked or crab crackers were available, I ended up using a fork), breaded shrimp (ok, nothing spectacular), breaded clams (I was really looking forward to these but I was disappointed, they were rubbery), corn was good and the seafood bisque soup was probably the best part of the meal!

5) dessert options were plentiful but the couple that we tried were a bit dried out, but still tasty.

I guess I'm not a real buffet person so I'm not the best judge (seems to be too much money for the little food I take) but as buffets go this one was good.

Our waitress was friendly and filled out drinks in a timely manner.
Great location with a variety food selection however, they advertise as unlimited lobster and crab legs....they were no lobster at all...

I really don't wanna sound mean but this buffet comes below average when it comes to "vegas buffet"..

We're in fremont area looking for brunch.. (even if we're not a heavy eater, vegas is known for their buffets! )

The good part is that, they have a cheaper price compared to others, 'specially in strip.. but I think that's it.. oh wait! They have a good au gratin potatoes! and their servers are nice too!

Here are the foods that I've tried..

Au gratin potatoes - what more can I ask for? as long as they have my cream, cheese and potatoes.. we're good!
Sausage - nothing special compared to the one in the grocery..
French toast - it needs a "taste" somehow..
Roast beef - this is the one that I was so devastated when it comes to main course.. tough and bland.. (their au jus is bland too) 
Carrot cake - it's my fave when it comes to cake but the texture seems old and coming in and out of the fridge.. the same with their sugar less chocolate cake.. I mean.. it taste okay but the texture is not..
OJ - doesn't taste good!? or he meant fresh!? that's according to my husband..

There's more that we got but as of now these are the foods that's sticked to my memory..
Most of the food is inedible. Best things were fried chicken and prime rib

I went here as my first break after getting off the plane here in Vegas. It's a buffet. It looked clean and there were a lot of staff ready to help. The food was good, I had the salads and pasta salads along with one plate from the back bar and I was stuffed. Nothing was absolutely amazing but I also didn't come on one of the steak nights. But it was a lot better than some of the reviews before had suggested.

Some buddies and I came here when we had some downtime from work. Going to a place on Fremont Street is much cheaper than most places on the strip, and Paradise is no different.

For three of us, the total came to less than $40 including drinks. Many buffets on the strip are $25-$35 per person. Now, the buffet wasn't as huge as some of those on the strip, but it had plenty of options.

The night we went was prime rib night. They also had whole chickens and turkeys available as well (slices, that is...you don't get a whole turkey for yourself you fat bastard). The salad and dessert bar is sufficient.

Maybe you like to have choices of foods from around the world (which usually means burritos, some sushi, pasta and some sweet and sour chicken) and don't mind paying three times as much for it. I am not one of those people.

went there in june 2012 the food was great and plentiful. the crab legs were always restocked and fresh. been here a few times since 2010 and will come back again when i'm in vegas. i've been to the buffet at the aria and this one is much better variety and flavor wise.
Second's a charm. Buffet breakfast is ok minimal but one more Omlete pancake chef would be great so there no line or long wait. Good variety. Gotta check it out.

Went to the Cafe Restaurant  for their tasty ox tail soup, simmered to perfection, fall off the bone tender, if you like cilantro order it on the side, they give you a huge portion.  my bowl seem a bit oily, they didn't skim off the oil, a definite winner on a cold night.  [ for those who wait till 11:00 to get your ox tail soup fix at the California Hotel, this is better.  When you get to the entrance you stay to the right, there is a seperate line to go the the Cafe.

we absolutely love the Ox Tail soup here. being from Hawaii, it something we've grown up on. they give a lot! tried the buffet for the first time because the waitress told us that the wait for ordering off the menu would be 45 minutes, yet that line was gone in 15... :/

Buffet-
Quantity : decent amount of food for a breakfast buffet.
Quality : for the price, can't really complain. 
Flavor : I'd give it about a 3.5 of 5

Menu - Hard to say as I've just ordered Ox tail so I'll rate based upon that.

Quantity : they give a LOT of meat for the price.

Quality : They must have it simmering in the back for a while because the meat literally falls off the bone. NO wasted meat lol.

Flavor : I enjoyed it. good additions with the water chestnuts and the shitake mushrooms.


the Service could use a little inproving. but it's just a suggestion/opinion. Not being critical ;)

Not that good and.for $19. Definitely not that good. Limited choices and generally just cheap food :( Langostine had no flavor at all, gumbo was blan, overcooked prime rib needed salt bad. Desserts were generic cake & pie. Paris had an Amazing buffet for $31. find a coupon and upgrade to WAY better food
Okay food. Okay selection. Awful attitudes from the waitresses, almost as if we were an inconvenience. May go there again.

I went to the champaign brunch both Saturday and Sunday. The food was your standard buffet affair... starches, starches and more starches, a bit of overcooked protein (ham, turkey and roast beef), and sugary deserts.

The only saving grace was the champaign... and they were stingy with that.

I ate alone the first day and I had to stare down the server to get a buzz. The second day I was with a friend who didn't drink so I was able to get my money's worth of grape by doubling up every refill.

The older I get the more I realize that I'd rather just pay for a good meal than unlimited refills of a bad meal.

So, bottom line, only go if you have a tea-totaling friend or desire diabetes within the course of a single meal.
OMG FIRDAY NIGHT BUFFET better then Bellagio I'm a local if you like CRAB this is the place for you!!! Great price really good crab!!!

Compare to hospital cafeteria food. Maybe because the staff look like they're ready to check into the hospital. Would have been $60 but got on groupon for $32.   Eclectic  assortments of chicken, Chinese, Mexican food. Salad bar was fresh.

Came here over 10 years ago...  Damn, maybe 15 - 20 years is more accurate.  But I ALWAYS remember this spot and always tell people about that ONE time I was there.  This is when Las Vegas still had relatively cheap buffets all over the strip and was not quite so expensive to visit.  

Well, looks like this place still has a relatively cheap buffet.  I was actually not of drinking age when I came that time and it was the first time I had Cherries Jubilee, which I loved. 

And many of their other brunch buffet selection was great.  Of course, my palate may be more sophisticated now that I am older but I would definitely want to come back here and see if it is as good now as it was to me before....

Paradise Buffer & Cafe is one of the best places to go for a buffet when you're in Fremont Hotel or with the Vacations Hawaii package deal! 

We didn't come here on time for the Seafood Buffet but they had the Prime Rib Buffet and that was awesome! Even for breakfast it was great with many varieties to choose from.

The service was also great! They were very attentive to the customers needs and wants and they were on it when I had and dirty dish or needed a drink to refilled. After coming here from time to time you notice the workers that has been here for a long time and to me, that's awesome! Thank you for the Great food, Greet service and having a close bathroom, just in case lol

I was craving prime rib and this buffet was right by my hotel.  It was on the inexpensive side and also to the point that I did not really enjoy the food.  Everything tasted old, the sushi was a roll of rice and the prime rib was not even worth going back for seconds.  Should of spent a little more and went somewhere else.  Also service was horrible.  My water cup spent more time empty and plates were not picked up in a timely matter.

$12.99 for a Vegas buffet isn't bad, and that's exactly what this one is... not bad.  It's also not great.  The salad bar has about 10 choices for veggies, imitation bacon bits, and only a few choices for dressing.  Friday night was cooked to order steak night and the steak was cooked perfectly (I think the steak chef was Kevin... Nice work) and whatever cut that was passed because of the seasonings and I assume meat tenderizer applied well in advance.

Fried chicken was tasty, baked potato bar had the same imitation bits, and the asian ribs were ok.  You get more than what you pay for, but that's not saying much compared to some of the other places in town.  If you are downtown and hungry, you won't leave unhappy, but you won't be wowed either.
Ate in the Cafe, not the buffet. Great service. Tasty breakfast food. Comfortable decor. I recommend it.

The Paradise Buffet inside the Fremont Casino is a hidden gem.  We ate here for lunch and saved about 35% from the buffet at the other Casino across the street.  What a pleasant surprise to see a marvel of a place run like clockwork with an efficiency second to none.  The food lines were well marked, a special section for salads, desserts, even a hotdog and hamburger Station. Choices were plenty including Americana, Chinese, Italian, and a carving station that was attended at all times.  Our choices included heaping plates of fresh salads, a helping of pasta topped with the mushroom chicken, plenty of pasties and fresh fruits and even an ice cream for dessert.  Good service from waitstaff keeping the ice tea filled.  A clean and fulfilling experience at the Paradise Buffet.  We would definitely make this a go to luncheon place the next time.
Nothing special and a bit overpriced. That said, to get anything substantially better, you'll pay substantially more.  Meh.

Tropical themed restaurant.  Been here for buffets which were decent.  Wanting to avoid the long buffet line, we opted to be seated for the cafe.  Getting seats for 6 seemed to be a challenge.  We were directed to the back and was told someone would be waiting for us to seat us.  Alas, no one was so we just seated ourselves.  What appeared to be confusion as another server asked us if we were supposed to be seated there or not.  Turns out, it was the right place.  Anyway, we waited....hmmmm... quite a while.  It seemed longer withTWO antsy toddlers who weren't shy about declaring their state of hunger.  The waiter hurriedly walked by and said he'd be right there.  He appeared to be on the verge of a hissy fit.   
We waited AGAIN even longer.  Finally, annoyed with the wait since we had just arrived to Vegas after roadtripping 5 hours, I walked over to the waiter station and asked for someone to bring us drinks.  
A minute later, our huffy server shows up with no greeting and asks us for our drink order.  We were already ready to order.  
Again,  another long wait.  I looked at my watch and noticed it's been over 20 minutes with NO DRINKS!  This has been my worst experience at the Fremont Hotel.  Again, I walked over to the wait station and asked for assistance. 
About another few minutes go by and then our drinks arrive.  No apology or explanation about the delay.  
Then our food arrives.  Now, the food was ok.  The American cuisine was pretty good.   But how do you screw up a patty melt or fried saimin noodles anyway? The Asian iterations could have been better.  The Korean ribs were not authentic.  Ok,if you like your bbq really sweet or never had true Korean marinated ribs.  
We noticed patrons who arrived long after us who already received their drinks and their food arrived at about the same time as ours.  NICE....
While we were finishing up our food, the server tells us he's going on a break and that "so and so" would take care of us.  Well it was a while before we saw this person since usually, we're introduced to the new server.
Anyway, this new server couldnt have been nicer.  She had a friendly disposition and almost simulataneously, hubby and I exclaimed we should have had her as our server plus our original server was going on a break?   It appeared he went on a break while we waited for our drinks.  Funny thing is, we devoured our food and was out of there so soon after we received our entrees.   
The new server was more empathatic and tried to explain how slammed they were with a new cook and that the previous patrons gave our server a difficult time.  My point was that it doesnt take THAT long to bring drinks and explain the situation.  Plus, why are we being punished because of other high maintenance sh**heads!!!  If the food was really crappy, I would give 1 star but the buffets I've experienced in the past were decent.  At the rate we were going, we could have just waited for the buffet...it may have been faster!

Purchased a discounted coupon book for the weekend. I was astounded and taken aback when the cashier, Luis, accused me of the booklet not being mine and Fremont did not honor the coupons. I ABSOLUTELY purchased the booklet and it DOES include the Fremont Buffet. Having spoken to others, I also found disgruntled guests of the Fremont. As far as the dining experience, James was great and very attentive. The food was very mediocre and selection very poor.  This is not a destination I would have selected however, a group of ten voted to "try" this morning buffet.  Your cashiering staff desperately needs customer service classes!   

I also want to add...
In today's Internet-driven world, customers have more power than ever. Satisfied customers might share  their good experience with a few friends, whereas an angry customer has the potential to tell thousands  on social media.  And for each customer that complains, there are thousands who don't. They just simply stop doing business with you. 

Suggestiol?  Go elsewhere.

Dear god was this place awful. Not only was it the smallest buffet I've ever been to, but the quality of the food left so much to be desired. I went here with nine people and we all left disappointed and hungry. Not to mention they had no vegan options. We asked one of the people working there and they pointed us to the fried chicken and said is that vegan. God. Okay. Stale bread and cakes, soggy salads, green/grey "prime rib", no vegan options. I would rather lose the 18 bucks gambling that I spent to get in rather than eat their food again.

I hate to give bad review to this buffet as tonight is our last night staying at Vegas and hopefully will get a good seafood buffet. We came around 9.30pm n the counter lady told us that we can stay there till 10.45pm. And yes we were seated near the entrance. And we were served by an unfriendly waitress. My daughter not purposely spilled the water on the table and she saw it and she went to get a towel. I was so surprised she dint clean it for us as a waitress .but at least she can gv it to me nicely  not by throwing the towel on the table.and when we leave we leave a tips which is $15.and she saw it and said something very loud at our back.ah tonight working so hard and only get $10!! I got so pissed and wanted to go back to the table and take my $5 n gv her the $10!! Working so hard like how?!!counter person over all great service! Just not the waitress that served us!!

Alright. Let's be real. 

The selection is nothing spectacular. A few meats, some sides, sushi, dessert. 

98% sure the mashed potatoes were instant and marinara sauce was canned. The prime rib was dry as the damn desert. And wasn't all that great (keep in mind I'm a Nebraska guy, pretty picky about my beef)

Waitress was nice. 

Decor outdated, which is to be expected in the older part of Vegas. But still. The ONLY reason it's getting two stars instead of one is because the waitress was sweet and attentive.

I came here for dinner, and like what many other reviewers said, you get what you pay for here. 

The casino has a lot of advertising that boasts all you can eat prime rib and etc. After paying and getting seated for dinner I saw that prime rib is the only thing people were standing in line for at the service stations - and with GOOD reason. 

The bf grabbed some sushi which I was too scared to try. I touched the rice with my finger and it was a sticky, rubber like consistency - a sign of bad rice. I didn't even want to try that. 

I grabbed some mashed potatoes, prime rib, sweet yams with marshmallow and bean soup. Everything except for the prime rib has the consistency of mush as it had been sitting on the hot plate for a long time. The bean soup tasted really terrible and left an aftertaste in my mouth. 

The prime rib was the only attraction here as the meat was juicy and decent for the price paid for the buffet. People were like vultures waiting for the prime rib and I had two people cut in front of me as we were waiting for it to come out of the oven. It's obvious that people come here to eat plates and plates of this meat. 

Save up some money and pay for a better buffet elsewhere.

I went here for lunch to grab a sandwich at the sit down part of the place.  My waitress was extremely awesome.  Brought out my food quickly.  Checked on me often.  Was genuinely happy that i enjoyed my food and took some time to chat w/me.  I enjoyed my Reuben sandwich and the coleslaw that accompanied it.  Good place to grab a bite when you don't want to pig out at the buffets.

When we arrived the place was packed full of people and prime time.  We had high expectations at first but soon were just looking for something edible.  The food was very bland.  Many of the dishes were missing key ingredients that changed their flavor profile completely.  Out of the entire buffet I found only 2 dishes that were even edible.  The sushi was just as horrible, for example the California rolls were very sweet, I believe it was in the rice, maybe instead of rice vinegar they used corn syrup? Lol, not sure really just gross.  The deserts were also a complete let down, some of the pies were even crusty like they sat out all day.  This was one of the worst buffets I've been to.

I LOVE buffets, but this buffet failed to win my heart. This buffet and I, we are just friends and nothing more. I visit it sometimes when I'm in town, but other than that, out of sight, out of mind. It's like that certain friend you sometimes feel obligated to hang out with just because you're "friends."  

Food was nothing spectacular. It was the usual buffet-type food, a little of this, a little of that. I love raw oysters, but the oysters here were just okay. They were still attached to the shells so I had to rip them off with a fork. The crab legs were good though. 

The decor was interesting. It was somewhat dark, but also quite cozy. The servers were great. They were always coming by, taking away plates and handing out more napkins. 

Okay food, good prices, good service. 
Oh Paradise Buffet, I really did wished our friendship could become something more, but it can't. It's not you, it's me. I just deserve something better. I hope you'll understand.

My wife, Aunt, and I decided to try out the Paradise buffet in the Fremont Casino.  It was seafood night.

Fortunately enough, my aunt went there first and waited in line.  By the time we walked in, she had already gotten us the table.  As you walk into the Buffet, the lighting is a bit dim and dark.  However, you can see and navigate.  The atmosphere is laid out like a safari or jungle.  Imagine the RainForest restaurant with no animals.  Unless, you think the large buffet people are hippos, elephants, or tigers grazing on the buffets...hee hee...

The wait staff was not that great.  For some reason, it looked like the casino has cut back on staff.  As a result, the service was a bit too slow for my taste.  Also, some of the utensils (i.e. crab breakers/nut crackers) were not available.  Need to stock up people!

As for the food, I headed straight to the king crab claws and was sorely disappointed, they were a bit frail and thin.  boo hoo... shrimp was okay... and I don't want to really talk about the oysters.  Let's say this, one look at the oysters and I had to sadly walk away.  It was puny and a bit too old for me.  

On the flip side, they had a great pasta layout.  But, it was the various "creole" sauce that stood out for me.  They had a clam sauce, a shrimp etoufee creole sauce, and another light creole flavor sauce.  It was pretty good.  The salad bar was okay.  However, the desserts and the fruits were very sweet and good.

Overall, the price per person is about $18 on seafood night.  If it was not for the creole sauce, this place would have received a lower rating... honestly, Asia buffet is still hands down my favorite... 

Cheers

As I wandered Fremont looking for a BLT, I finally found the Paradise Buffet/Cafe sign which had a BLT on the cafe menu. 

What I did not expect after being seated was to be blindsided by SAIMIN on the menu.  Yay!

Disclaimer: I am a white girl from Oregon who is no saimin connoisseur, but I have had what is billed as excellent, authentic  saimin before.  

This stuff is not the caliber of Hamura's on Kauai, but for what I expected from seedy Fremont, it's not bad!  The pork is a little well done and it's heavy on bok choy, but the flavor is good.  For $5.89 in Vegas, I'm not complaining.

This breakfast buffet was priced very well here at the paradise buffet located in the Fremont hotel. Be sure to have your card to receive the discount. Food was your average breakfast buffet items, bacon, ham, eggs, waffles, biscuits and gravy an omelet station. I'd recommend this if you're really hungry. Service from our waitress was awesome. She was full of spunk called all of us in our party sweetheart hehe. Gotta Love it. Overall good service okay food.
A gem!  Good food friendly staff clean place

Been coming here for 10 years and hubby & I always eat here on xmas or xmas eve (traditional because is where we had breakfast when we got married). This place has seriously gone downhill.  The floors were filthy, the food was NOT impressive and I am seriously disappointed. Everything, I mean everything tonight was just bad & selection was pituful. Do you want fush, shrimp, or fish...lasagna that tastes like it came out of the freezer,  or more breaded fish? NO vegetables of any kind except their bagged lettuce salad bar, not even steamed  broccoli or ANYTHING!!! Pasta was overcooked, fried shrimp greasy, dessert cakes/brownies were dry, ice cream machine dripping ice cream soup, "fresh sushi" I don't know who made it or where it came from I didn't see anyone making it fresh. Took forever just to get a refill. Don't think I'll come back here again. hope I don't get sick from the little food I did try to eat :/
Not worth it.  Rubbery pancakes.  Potatoes taste ... Strange.   Only thing that was decent was the prime rib.
Definitely worth the $18 bucks. All u can eat prime rib.just ask them to cut it thick for you.. they have plenty of deserts..all you can eat shrimp... decent prime rib in old town Vegas!!!

This buffet may be ok for the price but it is more geared toward a more older clientele.  Also there were some items I did not care for.  The baked fish and the au gratin potatoes could have been better.  The orange juice was too pulpy.  The setting looked old and bland.  The roast beef was ok.  The oatmeal was great and so were the sausage patties.  The service however was on point and top notch.  You're better off going to McDonald's, Du-Pars, Gold Spike or somewhere on or off the Strip for better food than a place that serves food that is on par with a Chinese style buffet.  I would come back for the sausage patties and the oatmeal but I would skip everything else unless you are that desperate.

Poor quality of food.   Vegetable choice was corn, mashed potatoes, or the salad bar. Steak was conveyor belt tough.   Every Golden Corral tops this place.  Service was good, but the food was bad.  The Tony Roma's in the same casino is worth the extra spend.

One of the worse experience I've had in my Las Vegas experience. Not worthy of your money and the service is awful. The waitress was a bitch to our group right off the spot. We did made the reservation on the phone and they said it was fine but in-person they said they don't take the reservation?!

Friendly service, and a decent buffet - nothing fancy, and the food did not blow me away ... but it's a Vegas buffet, and expectations should not be that high. 

If you are staying on Fremont St ... this place is a-ok. Ceasar salad, and mashed potatoes were yummy ... and they had a wide selection of sugar free desserts.

Good selection of food for the prices. Everything tasted decent and the staff was very friendly. I have been to many buffets before and felt like I've wasted my money but I was satisfied after leaving here. I wouldn't mind coming again another time

This place has so many pics around town showing all this awesome looking food and fresh sushi. My family and I went there spending 100.00 for all of us to eat at the buffet. It's sushi wasn't fresh at all, they made it seem like they had so many selections it was just 3 types of rolls.  All the food there wasn't that good tasting. Drinks were all watered down.

I went here for the buffet breakfast on 1/15 and it was awesome. They have all the favorites and it was just 20 dollars for my husband and I. We stayed at the plaza and this was in walking distance and a lot better than the buffet at the golden nugget.

I had gone to the early week snowcrab buffet and was very impressed!  Sadly, went to the Friday seafood buffet and was drastically underwhelmed.  They had taken all the claws off of the crab legs and you were left with very small pieces of crab and broken legs, etc.  

During my stay - ate here for breakfast, lunch and dinner.  The weekday breakfast is an excellent deal with a lot of selection.  The "brunch" on the weekend is overpriced and essentially the same buffet you get during the week. 

For the price - it's a good value.  Place is very dated but does give it a charm.

I mean, look, it is what it is - a cheap buffet that will fill you up. I came for the breakfast buffet, and after tax and drink, it clocked in around $10. However, the options were super limited, with just a few meats, pancakes, omelets, and insta-eggs. The eggs were just . . . wow they were gross.

Came here on Prime Rib night and the prime rib was lacking. It was dry, overcooked and tough. The other selections on the buffet were below average and lacked flavor or was just too dry or mushy to eat. The desserts were okay though. 

If you eat at the cafe side, get the Oxtail Soup. It's delicious! I wish I chose to go back to the cafe instead of the buffet...

I didn't have any coupons so paid 7.49 plus tax for this place.  I was pretty happy until I went to Main Street Cafe and paid 7.99 for three times the variety of food.  However, if you gots the coupon, then Paradise might be your bet.  I could really only find chicken worth eating...oh and a few items from the dessert area.

As far as Buffets go, it was decent. I've had better and I've had worse (Imperial Palace). Nothing about this buffet really stands out. The food selection was plentiful, but the quality of food could have been better. The lighting was really dark, which I didn't like. The wait staff were friendly and attentive.

The pricing is good and the service is better than at the buffet in the Vegas strip. We went there during the Thanksgiving week, it's so hard to find a place to eat for a family of 6 without super over-charged. The line moved quick and the food was acceptable and still with varieties. If you are on budget, just trying to eat a basic dinner and spend some time enjoying dinner with your family. It will do the job.

i really like this buffet. Ive gone to it twice. The first experience was better than the second.
I think Ive reviewed this already.

Horrible. Simply horrible. The food is way below average and not a single dish was even ok for the relatively cheap price. 

An old electronic board hangs above one of the tables and displays todays date as of january 14 1998. The board is however sadly not the only thing that's stuck in the 90's. The restaurant's interior screams tacky early 90's design, perfectly in harmony with the staff's hideous flower patterned shirts and dresses. How the owner hasn't thought of making a design change here is something I will never fully understand.

But the main part here is of course the food. I can honestly say that this is the worst buffet I've ever been to and I've been to plenty. Went there for prime rib night and was or course looking forward to trying their advertised prime rib. It was extremely blend and reminded me of the crappy pieces of meat I used to get for school lunch in first grade. The lasagna, macaroni salad, crab salad and even the desserts all tasted like last week's leftovers. Even the bread was stale and terrible. 

Also, as a nice surprise afterwards, I'm pretty sure I got food poisoned from the buffet. It ruined the whole evening afterwards and I'm not surprised now when I see that other fellow Yelpers have been food poisoned from there as well. 

When I left the place, I wanted to stand outside and warn people from going in there. My girlfriend literally had to stop me from doing so by dragging me away. 

So please, whatever you do, avoid this place at all cost. It's not worth ruining an evening or your whole trip because of the restaurant's cheap prices. This place feels like a crappy buffet on a cruise ship and will make you feel sea sick without even being on a ship.

it was ok. . . . ive experience this buffet many many years ago, prime rib and roast beef was very dry, there were little tiny friends roaming around their small sushi area. Our server took awhile to check on us but the ladies at the front was very friendly. Many other options near by to try but hey.. . . its a buffet, price should go down just a tab bit for what options they serve.

UPDATE 2013
This place is still great and has become a Las Vegas tradition for my friends and I. We stop here every time our trip coincides with one of the seafood nights (Tuesday and Friday). The soup of the day rotates and it is always a special treat when it is the clam chowder. The cold seafood continues to be the highlight of this buffet although the hot foods have gotten slightly better (although not enough yet to make this a 5 star buffet even at the very affordable price). We have turned many of our friends onto this place and the 11pm closing time is great for our friends that drive in from Southern California after work on Fridays. On our last trip, the crab legs were no longer split. I prefer them split as it makes them easier to eat, but I know others feel unsplit crab legs retain their taste better. The biggest surprise was that they now have added snow crab claws. They were delicious despite being a little hard to eat (although once you learn the trick they're easier to eat than snow crab legs even with the harder shell).
_______________________________________________________________

This was the surprise of my last trip. I really wasn't expecting much since you never really hear about any downtown buffets outside of the one at the Fremont's sister property: Main Street Station. Well, we were hungry and the seafood fantasy night sounded good so we decided to give it a shot. 

The room it is served in might be described as tacky by some, but I really like it. It has that old school feel. This is actually where Trent and Mikey ended up eating after losing all their money in Swingers. That movie does not come close to capturing the feel of this room. Plus the service was pretty good. 

The main draws of seafood fantasy night are the snow crab legs (split for easier eating), oysters, and peel and eat shrimp. The crab was pretty good. The shrimp tasted good too, but they were seasoned and I would have preferred them unseasoned. The oysters were awesome. I ate about a dozen and my friend had 2 dozen. I'm sure others in the buffet had more. These oysters were small, but tasted good and fresh. They were as good as any other oysters I've ever had; just smaller. I usually am weary of buffet oysters, even the Rio's famous seafood buffet has terrible oysters, but these were good. They also have a small sushi section which was pretty basic shrimp nigiri and California roll variations. I'm surprised they didn't have more variety. They also have a clam chowder that no one notices because they put it next to the honeydew melon. I had actually finished eating and wanted to get a few pieces of melon for dessert when I noticed it and got a bowl. The chowder is very good. My friend said it was the best thing at the buffet. He ended up skipping dessert and eating another bowl of the chowder. Actually, instead of using the little chowder bowls, he grabbed an ice cream sundae bowl from the dessert station and got himself a huge bowl of clam chowder.

The other items in the buffet are also mostly seafood. Nothing really stood out except for the trout which was very good. Some of the items were a little on the dry side such as the lasagna that had almost no ricotta and the seafood enchiladas. I would have preferred it if they kept more of their regular dishes instead of doing so many seafood dishes on seafood fantasy night. I like a little turf with my surf and the only items that weren't seafood, bread, or vegetables were the meats at the carving station and the fried chicken.

All in all, I was really impressed by the quality and price.

I am one of those old veteran longtime Vegas visitor that can still remember these awesome $7.00 buffet at the Stardust Hotel and Casino (this place has been torn down, by the way). Those days are long gone. Now, Vegas has turned into this expensive culinary experiences that will cost you in the range of $35.00 to $45.00 per person at hotels like Paris, Trump, etc. There is a restaurant where the hamburgers are $75.00 each. What?! 

Anyway, this no-frill buffet offers a variety of dishes for a relatively cheap price. I believe we paid $15.00 per person for dinner on the weekend. The wait was about 25 minutes which was not bad as compared to the likes of the Buffet at the Rio. The food is nothing special with your typical pasta, pizza, dry roast beef, water-filled ham, plenty of desserts, etc. 

This is a great place if you just want to fill your tummy so you can gamble downtown.
Great food. Great price. But most of all, it's all about Ramon. If you go, make sure you ask to sit in his station. He's the best!

Food is bland, and tasteless. Dry chicken, tasteless vegetables, questionable tasting baked potato, hard, and dry desserts. Everything is unfavorable. 
Place was clean
Staff nice
Ambiance okay

I highly enjoy this place, usually cheap and is located in Old Vegas.
They usually have the unlimited crab legs and other sea foods available, which is delicious. They also have a great dessert selection.

I enjoyed it, however, this past visit they hiked up the price for the seafood, which wasn't worth it. The selection was minimal.. so at $30/pp, not necessarily worth it. Otherwise, it's usually super cheap.

I had eaten here before and it was terrific. I tried again on a Sunday and it definitely wasn't worth the extra $5. The food was all bland and we had to chase down the waitstaff to get our drinks refilled.

I like this place cause I used to go here as a kid with my family. I remember liking the Crab Leg night, but I went back recently on a regular night and it felt kind of sad. The sushi was terrible. I liked the mashed potatoes and the cream sauce chicken, that's about it. The waiters are terribly slow, too!

This buffet is located in the Fremont Hotel and Casino located on Fremont street in downtown Las Vegas.

The buffet has a kitschy tropical theme.  It's  a little sad and reminds of a time when the South Pacific was more trendy than it is now.  The buffet is smaller than the one at the Main Street Station and not as nice as the Golden Nugget buffet.

The food was fine but there wasn't a large variety.  The dessert was actually good.  The atmosphere was dark and gloomy.  The servers seemed worn and tired.  My server complained that after his 8 years of working there, they changed from Coke to Pepsi and now he's all confused.

This isn't a buffet like those on the Strip, but it's pretty inexpensive so not a bad investment.
For the price this place is awesome! My husband and I ate here 5 out of 7 days we were here. Great staff and great food!

Very friendly and prompt staff. Terrible, horrible food. Fresh prime rib was dry and hard. Baked potatoes were rubbery and butter did not taste like cream, it tasted more like melted plastic. The corn and bean veggies were definitely frozen before and were probably cooked over and over again. The desserts were okay, surprisingly. 
Even for $14 a person for dinner, this is not a good choice for AYCE. You might as well get a good steak and very good sides at Second Street Market Grill a few feet down.

Not sure why this only has 2.5 stars...maybe people are comparing it to buffets on the strip. Obviously it's not going to have everything but for the price the selection has a nice variety. The brunch includes breakfast lunch and dinner options. This classic Vegas hotel and casino buffet offers great selection for a great price only $13.50 with players card!  Really nice comfortable atmosphere with great and friendly service.
Very good Vegas buffet! Wednesday night = all you can eat steaks....and the steaks are good! I highly recommend this buffet if you are staying downtown and you're really hungry!
$22 seafood buffet was excellent with crawfish, raw oysters, shrimp, and tons and tons of crap legs!

Worst tasting food I've ever experienced at a buffet.  Roast beef was dry, turkey was dry, chicken was moist, the crab legs were good, It was cold though. Price isn't too bad, but if you was tasty food then you may as well go to a fast food restaurant.

it was ok, seafood night with peel and eat shrimp and Dungeness crab legs.  There were some hot seafood items and a good salad bar.  Don't  go to the Rio seafood buffet and expect the same thing in other places,  of course this buffet was  much less expensive and seemed to be very popular.   I'm  not sure how close they watch but there is a sign at the entrance asking you to limit your time to 90 minutes.

Went on Tuesday for seafood buffet and had to wait in line for 20 min. The crab legs were way too salty and barely eatable. Small assortment of food and not much variety in cooked vegetables (only mixed corn and peas). Very rude host, we asked for a cloth napkin and she rolled her eyes and said we were at a buffet..

BYPASS THE BUFFET!!!!
Wasn't this place called Lanai's in the past?  My friend who's also from the islands goes to this place all the time.  So, when I went to Vegas with him, he had nothing but good things to say about this place.  The secret?  Bypass the Buffet.  All the mainlanders eat the buffet.  But if you're from the islands, you have to eat at the Paradise Cafe in the back.  The lighting is dim, but who cares, I don't like people watching me eat anyways.  I've actually got in a fight with people who stare at me.  Anyways, go back there and be treated to the REAL island food.  Spam, rice (the sticky kind that's washed - not the minute rice that no self respecting islander would ever touch), Portuguese sausage, etc.  If you don't wash your medium grain rice and then measure it with your finger, you might not be using authentic sticky rice.  So, I walk into this place and see this nice buffet spread.  My friend tells me to keep walking and leave the buffet alone.  So I do.  We end up in the back at the Paradise Cafe where I see nothing but islanders eating.  This place MUST be good.  So we sit down and our waitress come around.  She has an island accent so I know this is going to be good.  What does everyone order?  Spam, eggs, and rice.  Now, I don't know if you know this, but the islanders like to eat.  So, when they bring our food out, it's overflowing over the plate.  They put a full can of fried Spam, a dozen eggs, and 2 cups of rice on my plate.  I also ordered Portuguese Sausage.  This is some good stuff.  The waitress keeps coming by asking if we want anything else.  Heck yeah.  We need more rice.  She hooks us up on the rice too.  She brought out a BIG bowl of rice so we can finish our Spam and sausage.  I can't finish my food, but everyone else doesn't have a problem with it.  For some reason my friend also ordered toast with it.  Toast?  Why not more rice instead of toast?  I think he sold out.  I keep looking around and it's nothing but islanders walking in.  She comes by to see if we needed anything else but we were good.  We then start asking her about some local island/asian store around here that we can get portuguese sausage.  She starts to tell us about some place that everyone goes to.  I was tempted but since I live in Cali, it would have gone bad by the time I got home.  Everytime I go to Vegas, this is a place I HAVE to go to.  You should try it too.

Ok, if you're traveling with Vacations Hawaii, you know that they give you meal coupons.  You can use them here.  And go on Tuesday when it's SEAFOOD BUFFET NIGHT!  With your coupon, you'll pay 6$ and it's all you can eat SEAFOOD!  

They've got shrimp cocktail, shucked raw oysters, a variety of fried dishes (shrimps, oysters, etc), broiled fishes, and best of all CRAB LEGS!  These crab legs are cracked open for you already so you don't have to work hard to eat them.  You can pile your plate high with awesome peeled open crab and eat to your hearts content all for the low price of 6$ if you've got that coupon.  Pretty epic.  I was pleased.

Terrible food for a buffet the prime rib was overcooked and dry ,the seafood bar if that is what it was has a bad selection we will not go back with all the buffets in Vegas you would think they would put some effort !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

It's O Kay! 
The seafood night is Tuesday!
It's $27.99!
They have crab legs, oyster, shrimps and crawfish..!
The oysters were good! 
Crawfish were O Kay! 
It was just O Kay..!

We came here on a Tuesday at 5:40pm and this place was busy.  There were a lot of people already eating and the line to get in was just starting to get long slightly.  The food here was as good as a buffet could be.  Tuesday was the seafood fantasy day which was $21.99 per person.  If you had the player's card, then it was $1 off.  There were only two different kinds of fruit unless I missed the others.  Our waitress seemed like she did not want to be there, but she still refilled our drinks.
