Yesterday the buffet featured prime rib. It was outstanding.  They seamed to run out of a few other things before closing though. Today the buffet features seafood. Here we go.

My parents gave me the first name Matthew and the middle name Nathaniel because in Hebrew both of those names mean "Gift From God."
Well, if you ask me, God's greatest gift of all is the Paradise Buffet in Las Vegas on Fremont St in the Fremont Casino!
For me, the ideal plate looks like this:
50% Potatoes Au Gratin, 20% Biscuits and Gravy, 20% Cheese/Mushroom Omelette, 10% Miscellaneous! I don't count the drink as part of the plate but I usually have a water and a Coke.
It's the perfect thing for the morning after to sop up all the Whiskey, Cocaine and Jizz from the night before!
Yum Yum Gimme Some!

The 12.99 Special of Steak, Potato, shrimp , salad, dessert and drink was a perfect Vegas experience. Everything from the plastic Palm trees to the Gold lights. Enjoy yourself. The steak was actually decent , just as good as outback or longhorn. Must try.

We came here for brunch on a Saturday.  The wait wasn't long and our server was excellent (probably the best we've had at a buffet).  Our drinks were never empty and she was very attentive - not something I was expecting at all.  The food was decent, especially the omelet station and the breakfast potatoes.  My husband had the prime rib and said it "wasn't very prime".  But, overall, the food was decent especially given the price.  Two people for around $20?  That's a steal in Vegas.  I can't comment on the dinner buffet since we didn't go.  But maybe we'll try that next time.

I stopped by here this past Saturday night with my fiance for dinner.  According to the menus that were hung everywhere in the casino that meant that it was prime rib night which I was eagerly looking to.  I also noticed on a ton of signs that is was the largest buffet on Fremont Street which is interesting since the Golden Nuggets the next morning seemed bigger.  As we were walking into the buffet I was quickly reminded of some Rain Forrest cafes that I had been to.  It had those large palm trees as well as some other lush tropical looking plants.

The food at this buffet was just ok.  It actually reminded me quite a bit of the Golden Corral, lots there but no quality to it.  Yes there were peel and eat shrimp and crab legs but they were fairly meager which I guess is indicative of the price here.  They are had a random collection of other ethnic foods including a taco bar, sushi and random Chinese food.  Finally the prime rib.  What can I say about the prime rib?  Was it really prime rib or was it another cut of a tougher meat?  I have never had prime rib with the amount of connective tissue that was in some of the pieces of meat that I had here.  With that being said I really enjoyed the Cajun-esque seasoning that they put on it and I went back for more 3 separate times.  The desserts were really where this place shines as there were a ton of them and what I had was pretty good.  I ended up having key lime pie sans the crust and some carrot cake and both we pretty tasty.

The bottom line for me is that I might stop by here again in the future.  It's not the worst buffet that you can get downtown but its not the best either. I guess it all depends on what you want your price point to be and what kind of quality you want in your food.

Prime rib today was a bit dry. But when they get to the middle its a little too rare.  
Everything else was good. Great service too. ^.^ our server was joking with us in Vietnamese too. Woot woot

The worst buffet I've ever been to.  They sat us at a dirty table. Moved ourselves to a cleaner table only to have dirty silverware and crumb filled booth. Waitress was a bit rude and food was horrible. Do not waste your time or money. Scalloped potatoes that are mediocre at best should not be the highlight of your breakfast. Maybe Fremont street buffets are supposed to be horrible. It will be the first and last time I ever go to one.

I have eaten here in the past and the crab legs were pretty good, Well I guess they have gotten cheap and replaced the normal crab legs with a blue crab (idk) It was horrible horrible horrible. I felt totally taken advantage of. The rest of the food was not that good either, bland, no taste and just plain nasty. Fruit Flies every where, you could hardly enjoy your food even if you did like the food. I normally don't go this far with reviews, but this was just horrible. I know it's a buffet but that does not mean you have to serve the poorest quality of food. Oh and to top it all of I have been double charged......for this horrible meal. Believe me I won't be back!!!

Oh...and I think it's time for a upgrade..this place looks old and outdated.
So disappointed...but at least our server was nice and attentive.

It's a hit or miss over here.. Went here for the seafood buffet and just ordering off the menu. For the seafood buffet I would've given it 5 stars the selection was huge, the server was  very attentive and it was fresh I deducted it two stars bc when I went there another day to just order off the menu was horrible the stuff we order was bland and tasteless not worth the money. I would just go here for the buffet only.

This place popped my Vegas buffet cherry. And it was a pretty sweet first time. 

We were all dying of starvation and heard about the awesome buffets on Fremont street, so we chanced it on the Deuce to see what we could find. We picked the Fremont Casino because let's face it, we were on Fremont street and it was poetic. 

Here we got the champagne brunch and I do believe it was $11.80 with tax. Other people here are saying like $7 but I didn't see that at all, maybe I was too smitten with the words "champagne brunch." 

I worked on stocking up for the apocalypse at this buffet. I think I had bacon, sausage, eggs, waffles, french toast, and some fresh fruit for breakfast. After that we digested for a few minutes then I had prime rib, mashed potatoes and gravy and then some ice cream for dessert. Impossible? I think not. The french toast was surprisingly good and the sausage was awesome too. Another big plus was the mashed potatoes and gravy, I know I shouldn't fill up on carbs at a buffet but they were SO GOOD! And let's face it, I got my money's worth any way you slice it. 

They came around for drinks and I decided to make my own mimosa, ordering orange juice and champagne. I emptied my champagne into my OJ and then when I came back from the buffet again there was more champagne in my glass! Thank-you champagne fairy! 

The atmosphere was dark and just funny. It's being paradise and all it was tons of fake plants, but it was so great for a Vegas buffet. We didn't regret our choice at all and we could barley walk when we left. And yes, I would consider that a glowing review lol.

Side note: After rewatching Swingers, yes, this IS the place where Vince Vaughn and Jon Favreau go to eat breakfast at the beginning of the movie. If that doesn't sell you, I dunno what does!

Here's my recipe for a perfect Vegas trip: Three parts obscenely cheap to one part ludicrously expensive. The $10.99 champagne brunch at Paradise Buffet is the perfect flavor for the obscenely cheap part of that recipe. 

Are there even cheaper brunch buffets to be found in the City of Sin? I'm sure there are, but this is the perfect three star buffet for me. For the most part, it's what you'd expect from an $11 buffet - some of the stuff sucks, some of it is okay, the bacon was dishearteningly bad, but the prime rib was surprisingly delicious. They do tout themselves as a "seafood" buffet, but... that seafood wasn't looking too hot, so I stuck to the carving station.

And, of course it wouldn't be called a champagne brunch without the champagne.... that they bring to you in these awesome plastic champagne glasses (not flutes, but the older saucer lookin' ones). And, boy do they keep it comin'.... and comin'... and comin'. It's not one of those places that proudly declares endless champagne and then a waitress is nowhere to be found. No sir. You'll be lucky if you EVER see the bottom of that little plastic champagne glass here.

All of this in the lush, dark, tropical setting of The Paradise Buffet. A-OK through and through.
The worst buffet ever!! They don't season their foods. Imagine macaroni salad with just mayo and carrots added--gross! Mashed potatoes was they best they had and that's hard to screw up.

If you have a fanny pack, a glitter-covered visor that reads "Viva Las Vegas" and enjoy bland, tasteless food, this place is for you. 

My boyfriend and I visited here after seeing the special on the outside signage: "steak, shrimp, salad, beverage and dessert for $12.99". We were trying to do a budget trip, so figured this wouldn't be bad for us. By the time we got in there (3:30pm), the salad bar wasn't ready, so we had to wait until 4pm. At that time, we figured we should get the buffet since it was only $5 more. I went back in line and waited about 15-20 minutes. Then we began to eat! The All American section was mashed potatoes and baked potatoes, the roast beef was so dry--it literally resembled a piece of leather, the dessert was tasteless. Literally, had NO flavor. The prime rib was actually pretty good. But, I had a bite or two of the other food and did not touch it again.

Needless to say, we both left hungry and unsatisfied with upset stomachs. Best bet is to get a nice dinner somewhere else. Skip the buffet.

been here several times over the years. Mostly had breakfast, it was always tolerable with a Fremont hangover. 
Went for dinner Wednesday night, apparently it was "steak night" which upped the price to about $16. 
Literally everything I ate was terrible garbage and I left hungry. 
The "steak" was at best bulk bought truck scraps soaked in fake flavorings to taste like an actual grilled steak. The pasta was terribly overcooked and was like mushy tap water. The chicken picata was dry as a bone. The italian sausage was some sort of generic cafeteria meat. What I thought would be the saving grace was just some nacho cheese sauce and tortilla chips, but even the chips were stale as can be. 
This place was so gross I left hungry.

AMAZING CRABS!!!! Mountains of them! And they are also pre cut unlike some buffet places where you actually have to fight to open them.. :) and that's pretty much the only thing we ate! Man! They are so delicious though! Oh and they did cold and hot crabs!! But I always prefer cold with hot butter! :) 

They have lots of different food also though! Taco bar, prime rib, salad bar! But to be honest I just wanted to eat those crabs! And plus you never have to wait for them to come out with more because there are always tons of them!! 

Desert bar is also pretty big! And they will serve you coffee after your dinner too!! Well worth the money to go to seafood night! :)

This restaurant, located inside the Fremont, on "Fremont Street Experience", has something for everyone...The tropical decor is all inclusive.....I went on "Steak Night"...so in addition to sampling Seafood, Tex-Mex,Italian,"All-American", and the salad bar, I had to have a New York Steak...medium -well....and for dessert, Carrot Cake..wow....gotta go here when in Downtown Las Vegas....
Good food and great choices. Waitresses are very friendly and great service.  Could use more veggies. Lots of desserts.

Walked in off the street.   We had breakfast.  It was delicious.  There was a variety of food.  We saw the lunch buffet being brought out and it looked scrumptious.  I recommend this place highly and the prices are very reasonable.  Breakast was $6.79 and lunch was not much more.  The dinners are more and they have different specials for dinner but I was leaving that day or I would have been back.

Went to the breakfast buffet on 2/28.  We had the 2 for 1 coupon so you can't beat that.  The food was good and we had a really nice waitress. My only complaint, the cashier was very unfriendly. She made me feel like having the coupons was more work for her.  But other then that, we enjoyed it.

This buffet is in the Fremont. I went to the breakfast buffet. It's about the same size as the Cal except that it had an omelet  station. the food was ok. No Portuguese sausage served here surprisingly. The food was ok but I like the Cal or Main Street breakfast buffet better. The servers were friendly and they give discount for having a players card. I'll try lunch or dinner next time and update my review...  ^_^*~

Seafood buffet night....tons of crab legs and claws to crack then make piles of crab meat to devour in seconds with butter.....then repeat = awesome.

Prime rib night is not too shabby too.  Worth the price.

Would prefer to give 0 stars.

OMG. 

Awful. 

Just the saddest grouping of food for the saddest group of people.  

Worst place we ate the entire week we were in Las Vegas.  

Never, 

Never again.  

We even promised each other never to speak of this!

I've never really had a good experience with buffets. Paradise Buffet and Cafe Restaurant reminded me why I avoid them.

Yes, it's Vegas. Yes, they are known for world-class food and excellent buffets. Just remember that NONE of them are located in Downtown Las Vegas. 

The establishment is located in the Fremont casino. It's large and maze-y with roomy booths. The decor isn't vintage; it looks like a 1980s highschool set for Wizard of Oz. There's alot of green.

First off, our waitress didn't know what half-and-half was when we requested it with coffee. She kept pointing to the french vanilla creamer already on the table. I already had a feeling I wasn't going to like this place....

They had a decent variety of food from American hot-dogs and patties wading in gray, hot water to Italian pasta, dried out from the hot lamps to "Chinese" stir-fry that could rival any MacCormack seasoning packet available at most grocery stores. I opted for jambalaya, fried chicken, mashed potatoes, and beef roast from the carving station. I've never had jambalaya before (at this point) so wasn't sure what to expect; it tasted okay:lots of sausage and my friend told me it tasted like it came from a can. Can you go wrong with mashed potatoes? Yes, even Paradise can! When I attempted to add butter to the flavorless mash, I could only find margarine...Ugh, isn't anything real here? Not too surprising, after all, they didn't have half-and-half... Everything ersatz! 

Fresh fruit and a piece of apple pie for dessert. Pretty sad when the fruit was the best part of the meal. 

Lunch buffet cost about $9. A bargain, one might say, for a "Vegas" buffet. All the strip buffets were starting around $30.

There's a reason why the restrooms are located at the exit of the restaurant with large, brightly-lit signs. Now, I love food, and if that food disagrees with my digestion but it tastes delicious, I'm willing to give a little leeway. When I eat a less than mediocre meal and additionally have the inconvenience and discomfort of immediately needing a restroom, I am not a happy camper. In toto, six out of our group of eight ended up in the restroom. The women's bathroom was clean, however, the males in our group recounted a disgusting state of the men's restroom.

Why 2 stars in stead of 1? Although the entire experience was sub-par, there is a possibility our 6 days of Vegas binging finally caught up to us and contributed to our sickened state. Even without sickness, not worth $9.
Breakfast is your best bet. The other meals are subpar. We get free comps and still only go there for breakfast.

This is for their oxtail soup only:

If you're a Hawaii local and you remember the oxtail soup from Kam Bowl/Asahi Grill Keeaumoku, but now you're on a trip to or relocated to Vegas, then this is the oxtail soup for you! Forget about going to the Californian. I mean, really, oxtail soup does not have celery and carrots and peas. 

This is the authentic oxtail soup where the meat falls off the bone. Generous sized pieces with boiled peanuts, water chestnut, mushroom, chinese parsely (cilantro) and a side of grated ginger and two scoops of rice. My only complaint is that the water chestnut pieces are large, rather than using slices. The broth is flavorful and to top it off, it's inexpensive compared to the other local food establishments at other Sam Boyd casinos.

Definitely worth a visit. Just bypass the buffet line as ask for the cafe seating.

Located in The Fremont Hotel Casino on Fremont Street in Downtown Las Vegas. I went for breakfast. I hate to give a bad review. One word Yikes!  The selection was scant. I had a danish, I am not saying it was stale, but I wanted dessert not a weapon. There is better and cheaper in Las Vegas. Live it up you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!

Thank God the bathrooms were at the entrance. The buffet will give you an instant BM, and I don't mean a Buffet Menu. 

This "Paradise" was like a trip through the Inferno. And at least with Dante, the heat will kills off the lukewarm meat. The only thing that was cooking was listeria. 

I've served Thanksgiving dinners at soup kitchens that are 5 star restaurants compared to this.

Oh and let's talk service and cleanliness. Insurgent IEDs are less well camouflaged the the myriad of mildew and food scraps secreted on the carpet where a wad of gum stuck to my sister's leather bag.

Upon informing the supervisor about the gift with purchase, Adele, the manager, just said, "we clean the floor once a day." "What do you want me to do about it?" 

Pretty sure people in jail get better service. And better food.

This place has a very 70-80s feel to it. Low ceilings, decor, food-- its all reminiscent. Expect "golden corral" style steak, spahgetti, frozen cake, store bought taquitos, etc. For $16, this isnt a terrible deal, but know this isnt anything special.

Cheap. Roomy. Great staff. Aloha kine vibes is the best kine vibes lol definitely going to come back when ever I get the chance to visit Las Vegas downtown! It's always nice to see local people from the islands!
Good variety of food and dessert.  Really funky decor and friendly helpful staff.  Good buffet, but it's really inexpensive.  Great option if you're in the area.
Went to the prime rib buffet while in Vegas. Decent prices and good food. We would go back.
Known for the crab legs!  I prefer the cold seafood bar over the steamed.  Def a belly filler Buffett.  Not to bad on your pocket book!

What do you expect in downtown Vegas from a buffet. There is nothing special about this one either. The service was okay and the food average. I had the breakfast buffet had scrambled eggs, hash browns, and toast. I could have had the same at Deny's and paid less.

Solid menu, descent quality, GREAT price! 
Loved the atmosphere, dim lighting, digging the paradise tropical theme:) 

The Food: they have make your own shrimp cocktail, fresh strawberries and bananas, bagels and lox. They had a bomb salad bar w this delish seafood salad! 
Hot Food: make your own thanksgiving dinner, egg omelette station, pancakes, french toast! Coffee and frozen yogurt w toppings and baked pastries! Fun date night get creative w your buffet! Definitely going back, next time we visit Vegas

First off you get what you pay for.  The food isn't good and actually hurt my stomach. The quality isn't good but then again what do expect from a cheap buffet.  They advertise sushi but trust me it's not even edible. It was gross!  Desserts are so so.  The only thing somewhat ok was their fried chicken.

Very basic breakfast buffet. Sliced ham, sausage patty, scrambled eggs, biscuit and gravy, sausage, fruits, cereal and oatmeal. The really only different item was a mexican pot pie which consisted of some crumbled meat, egg, and geeen chili baked in a pie shell. They also had a too order omelette station. Drink service was good but picking up dirty plates was slow. It was easier just to stack the plates on top of each other and eat off the top one. I won a free breakfast buffet for tomorrow but I am debating if the gas and tips for parking and waitress is worth the "free" buffet.

We came here on Prime Rib night and I will say that the Prime Rib was good, however I would have enjoyed it more if I could enjoy some side dishes with it. If you come on Prime Rib night I recommend just eating the Prime Rib. The carrots tasted like they were over cooked and underdone at the same time. I suspect they were previously frozen, which is not a big deal as long as they are cooked in a way where you can't tell. The sushi was terrible because rice was mushy. The Parmesan cheese they had was really weird and when I put it on my pasta it gave it a weird granulated texture. It is hard for me to describe the Parmesan cheese's weird flavor, but the color was off because it was pure white, maybe it was fat free?  

The servers were really nice and very attentive. Our drinks were refilled consistently and they were very polite and friendly. I also really liked the ambiance, so it is a shame the food disappointed me so much.

Overall, okay food for the price of the buffet. 

First, we were able to get a discount because we had coupons and ended up getting the specialty buffet for $10 - for that price you can't go wrong with filling up on food. However, the taste and selection? Okay at best. 

We went on seafood night and had called ahead to make sure they had crab. We originally wanted Joe's Crab Shack, only to find out they closed, ugh. Their Crab selection was abundant but tiny crab. The cold crab was the largest but flavorless - soaking it in hot butter was my solution. They had roast beef but looked so deceivingly like prime rib - they even had horseradish and au jus! But don't be mistaken, it was nowhere near prime rib. They say they have sushi bars, but they have a small sushi section - maybe 3 plates of selection. That is definitely not a sushi bar. 

You can order off the menu as well, which we did for my daughter because they said she can't have the buffet  very questionable there but okay. It's very limiting on selection. She had your basic eggs bacon and rice - can't mess that up right? Overcooked scrambled eggs and mushy wet rice, that's just horrendous. She ate bacon and fed her again later, so disappointing. 

Service- the cashier at front tried to charge me for 6 buffets when we had 3. No customer service at all, just a rush through and no smile. Working in some form of customer service means a bit of common courtesy - I know very well it's taxing to deal with all types of people, but knowing what you're signing onto and the fact that you want people to come back. Our waitress was pretty attentive most of the time, no complaints there. 

If the buffet costed more than $10 I would not return again. Regular price is $25, so without a coupon I would not return. You can find many other buffets with better food. I would not recommend unless you're on a budget and rather spend your money on gambling!

Meh is the correct. We went here because we saw all the signs for the seafood and whatnot. UGH. Wrong choice there. First let me start with the fact that the entrance to buffet is also right next to the entrances for the bathrooms. Lovely smell there. The hostess was nice. The server...well she pretty much ignored us until I actually had to flag her down to re-fill our water. The food...you get what you pay for. The "seafood" that was on all the signs consisted of just shrimp. I could not find these Crab Legs everyone is talking about. Also the shrimp was DIRTY!!! Like DIrty!!! Like they hadn't been de-vained right. My boyfriend and I decided to stick to the fried foods just to be safe. I mean....it pretty much reminded me of like a Hometown Buffet or something. Not what you would except to find in Vegas. We tried it. We didn't like it. We won't be back.

It's a Hawaiian theme here without getting laid. At least in my experience. Every buffet in LV will have specials, themes, parties, etc so try checking the website or call in. There are people who absolutely love seafood night so that's why I'm saying. I'm not particular but was there for seafood night. It's people mad dashing the crab legs section and putting as many legs as possible on their plates. I had one crab leg but I don't have the love of crab legs enough for me to wrestle with it and pulling out a few chunks of meat for me to go back. 

It's a great buffet if you're in the Freemont section. I'd go back for sure. Do me a favor. Don't ride the zip line if you're feeling queasy. I don't want yack on me as you fly through the air over the hoards of drunks. Thanks.

One of the worst if not the worst buffet I have ever been to. I went for lunch one day I could not find a single dish I liked.i maybe had a few fried shrimp but other than that there is nothing I mean by nothing special about this buffet.

Horrible!! We went there because the dining options downtown are slim. Everything was cold and poor selections. I got a plate of food I thought was edible and got back to the table. Couldn't get anything down! Went back to the the line and asked for a refund. It took almost as long for the manager to come as it did for me to try to find something to eat in that dump. He gave us a refund without any questions or apologies. While I was waiting for him to come, I was talking with one of the girls that sets the customers. She asked me why I wanted a refund, I told her the food sucks and everything is cold. She said oh, I've never eaten here. Well there you go!
This place was a waste of my $50.00 Food was horrible. The crab legs are salty the prime rib was dry, and everything else was fried and greasy! I want my money back!!

This is a buffet on Fremont st, a buffet on Fremont st. People do not go to Fremont st for the food, they go for the booze and cheap entertainment. This buffet knows that and they are not trying to impress anybody. The interior is as expected, very 70s some place your parents or grand parents went to when it looked modern. The food selection is very limited. Literally about 25-30ft of hot table, a smallish salad station and a dessert bar. The food was mediocre nothing to go on about, if your in the area desperate for a buffet maybe give this place a try. Maybe

Eric T. just reminded me that I forgot one of my buffet adventures.  My parents and I decided to go here because we had dined in the California Hotel so much.  This is their seafood buffet night.  The first funny thing...well maybe it wasn't funny for them, was the couple in front of us.  The cashier ran their credit card through and said, "Do you have another card?"  The husband looked puzzled.  I turned to my mom and said:

"Do you think she told her husband about all the cash advances she'd been taking out on that card?  I bet she's so out of control, she can't keep track."  (evil laughter)

Mom: You're terrible (but she laughed with me)
Me: The apple don't fall far from the tree
Mom: (pause) You're adopted (evil laughter)

So yeah, the apple don't fall too far.

I ate turkey and roast beef, shrimp scampi, salmon, and Louisiana style seafood stew.  lasagna, California rolls, peeled shrimp, and a little salad...the healthy part.  I had lemon meringue pie, key lime cheesecake, and a mini eclair. 

Me: Okay, I'm full.

The second funny thing was this little kid kept running around the buffet line and the manager chasing him down to scold his parents.  The last funny thing is the woman who took her sweet time and had to make everything neat on her plate.

Because the Fremont Hotel is part of the Sam Boyd Chain, the meal cost us $6 each.  Not a bad deal.  We then slowly walked out to Fremont Street to watch the Experience.  It was a fun evening with the parents.
Actually this is the best buffet with the unbeatable price of $ 9.72 for a large variety of food in Las Vegas.

It was alright. What bothered me the most was the manager and the woman seating guests. They were outright arguing in front of customers. Plus we waited over half an hour to get a table.  Limited selection for the price...
Should have spent the extra cash elsewhere, at a buffet on the strip.  Simply cafeteria food.

I honestly had high hopes for this buffet, I don't know why. 

We went here twice, once for breakfast & once for a lunch (it was comped, I wouldn't have paid to eat here a second time).

It was gross. The eggs were gross, the sausages were OKAY, but really greasy. The french toast was harder than a.. I don't know, it was HARD and barely edible.

The desserts were overprocessed cafeteria food, I'm sure you can find better in an old folks home.

For lunch I tried the lemon chicken and chinese food - and lemon chicken tasted lemony, but had too much batter. I tried a few other items like meatloaf and macaroni and cheese and it was way overdone.

I guess people that don't really know better or what good food is thinks this place is okay.

It's cheap. That's about the only desirable thing about this buffet. Most of the food is heated and served straight out of the freezer. There were many things about this place that made it feel unsanitary. The waiter was awful and didn't even know the drink choices, I had to use the same fork for dinner & desert. And all the deserts are soggy or bland. They made sushi with American white rice and 'steak night' was overcooked frozen strip steak. Save your money & buy a deep fried Oreo at Nathan's inside the Mermaid Hotel.

It's really a 3.5 star place but, not close enough for me to give it 4 stars.  If you have a players card the buffet is $2.00 cheaper but, we were hungry so, we didn't want to go through getting the cards.  The ladies at the entrance were older and friendly and sort of matched this place which is definitely old Vegas complete with the overly floral design throughout the dining area.

Our server was quick to remove dirty plates and refill our drinks.  Friday night is their seafood buffet so we were extremely excited about that.  There were extreme highs and lows in food quality on the buffet.

Food to eat:  Roast beef and creamy horseradish sauce (be careful it's spicy), hot crab legs and drawn butter, mashed potatoes with gravy, fried rice, oysters, peel and eat shrimp with cocktail sauce and fried chicken.

Food I would pass on: Shrimp au gratin (definitely frozen shrimp), pasta, salad bar (everything was old and wilted), sushi (warm and flavorless), tacos (no just no), cold crab legs (not sure why they were serving some cold) and about half of the desserts that could possible be frozen and defrosted before being put out.

It's not a high end buffet and you can probably guess that from the $24ish dollar price per person but, if you come for the crab legs and are looking for a place to eat immediately it's a solid choice.

If I could give this place a negative 5 stars, I would.  First, we were treated like cattle to get into the place.  Once we got in (after paying 90 bucks for my family if 5) we were told we would have to sit at seperate tables even though they had empty ones situated right next to each other.  When we politely asked if we could move them together they looked at us like we were lunatics.  

Out of about 50 choices I could choke down a salad and their pepper beef.  Golden Corral or Hometown Buffet is about 100 times better, and they suck too.  If you still choose to eat here after reading this review why don't you walk around the back of any restaurant and eat directly out of the trash bin because that is where you belong, you tasteless idiot.  Did I mention that I DESPISE the servers, cooks, food, decor, location of this place yet...????

By the way, any one who gave this place more than two stars on Yelp should be ridiculed and banned from giving their opinion.  They can't be sane.

We went here twice while on our vacation. Once for a weekday breakfast and once for the champagne brunch. Both times were excellent but we will make it a point to hit the champagne brunch next year as there was more selection.

What can I say...the service was EXCELLENT....the food was well cooked and kept very fresh...there is an omelet station and I had eggs over medium cooked there and they were perfect...the fruit is so fresh and beautifully presented...lots of variety. Oh, and the ultimate for me...fresh brewed tea!!! Thought I had died and gone to heaven. :)

I noticed a woman doing paperwork at a table and learned she was a manager. I made a point of going to her and telling her what a wonderful meal we'd just  had. I am a shy person (well, until you get to know me and then I'll talk your ear off) so this was a rarity but I thought kudos were well deserved. 

Honestly, this is not just a vacationer spot...if I lived in Vegas I would go out of my way for the brunch.

The food was horrible. Some food was cold. The sushi nearly made me vomit. The only item that was edible was the ribeye. 

If you a looking for an inexpensive quick meal go to Mc Donalds. 

I don't know how this place hasn't been closed down yet.

I thought it was pretty good. Fish was fresh and food was refilled quickly. The overall quality I would say is much better than average buffet and the price is super fair. $20 for seafood buffet in Vegas yeah I'll take that. Also, it's nice to explore the Fremont area and get off the strip.

When a restaurant is this nasty, nothing else really matters. The food and service were whatever, but good lord this place is disgusting. We were sat at a large booth up front and the seats and table were covered in sticky crap, crumbs, the cracks between the cushions and edges of table looked like they haven't been cleaned in years.

A great choice for a last supper because you'd rather crucified than go back for seconds. If you like buffets but want to diet this is your place because you can't stomach a second trip to get food. All the meats and extras were cold. The selection slim. The desserts were hard, literally "clank clank" with your fork. I got excited for the ice cream until I bit into it and it tasted sour. Poor quality and WAY over priced. In fact I can't every remember eating worse food in my entire life. Best advertised as the "Worst Buffet in the World." Don't waste your money.

Price is good and taste is good for most dishes. Some dishes are a little effy, but they have a wide but limited selection. It ranges from steak to sushi, american to mexican, but you only get so much of each genre. The line went by quickly as well. Seating is good and the service was pretty nice. I would recommend it if you're hungry and don't want to break the bank. Great store location too right off fremont alley.

This place was so awesome for what it was worth. $11.99 for champagne buffet brunch!?!? AND If you have the Hawaiian coupon I think the meal is a dollar or two Unreal. It was great too b/c you can order menu items or get the buffet. .  Your choice which was perfect for our table. I of course got the buffet.  $11.99 and you serve:
- Lox and Cream Cheese
- Prime Rib
- Crab Legs
- Shrimp
- Lamb
-Eggs made to order
- and some bomb ass Gumbo

Not to mention the small cup of champagne that got refilled about 4 times. 

We usually go to the Market at the Cal but Fremont's Paradise Buffet and Cafe definitely has a one up.

I came while in Vegas, and this remains the worst service I have ever received in any type of Restaurant. 

Me and my fiancee were quickly seated and told to go ahead. We waited around for a bit for our waitress to take our drink order, after a few minutes, we decided to go get food. Got back with plate number 1, which was pretty small. Still no waitress or water on the table. 1/3 way through plate one, I ask a hostess for water, she tells me waitress will be there soon, but she's really busy.....

A minute or two later a waitress checks in on the table RIGHT next to me and asks if they need anything else and she starts to walk away..I flag her down and ask her for water, she said no, I'm not in her section and your waitress was very busy but would be there shortly.

Few more minutes go by and yet another hostess walks by, and I again plead for a glass of water. She stops, picks up the receipt, and says "you haven't even been here that long, your waitress will be here soon." She proceeds to go stand by the podium and do nothing. 

I finish plate and go grab another. Pretty annoyed. I get back and yet another employee walks by and again, I plead for a glass of water. I'm now nearing the point of just standing and up and screaming can I get a fucking glass of water. The employee says he can't get me water, but will go get my server. FINALLY my server comes over, no apology for the wait, no nothing..just a glare at me and "what do you want?"

I wanted to say, I'd like to eat at a place where the servers aren't bitches, but requested a water and juice. A glass of water was thrown down and juice was served.

Food was marginal. The cook at the omelet bar was friendly, but that was it.

Avoid this dump.
Seafood Buffett. Not good. Sushi looks like it was from a gas station. Crab legs ok but nothing else

OK, you are in Fremont Street and you want to try some good ole fashion Vegas eatery at some insanely low price.  So what attracts the eye as you stroll down through the casinos? All You Can Eat Prime Rib Buffet for $13.00.  Now if that doesn't get your juices pumping I don't now what does.  SO with that said, A group of us went there to give it a shot as we were clueless as to what else we want to try and figured the buffet would give us some options.  We walked into the line and there were quite a few people ahead of us (good sign right?).  The food there definitely matched the price we paid for it.  Now I am not the one to judge solely on a few items and by looks alone so I decided to try at least one thing from each section.  

First the good part: the Prime Rib was pretty tasty.  Not the best Prime Rib, but hey, I can't complain at this point.  It was definitely was savory and I was lucky enough to get it fresh when it came out.  If you decide to eat here just load up on this, you'll be happy...trust me.  The desserts were the next highlight.  The soft serve ice cream rivals that you get from a Souplantation with minimal toppings (fudge, nuts, strawberry in thick fruit sauce) but you can't really mess up when it comes to ice cream.  

The bad part: The sushi can definitely be skipped at this place.  I normally don't have high hopes for sushi at buffets but this one is nestled right next to the soft serve ice cream dispenser and cakes.  Again minimal selection and the the rice that was used was spongy.  I mean..i can take a little stale, but this just felt like I was eating something artificial.  

The rest of the food was below par (tried the fish, chicken, chow mien, and yams)....cannot comment on how it all tastes cause it was all just pretty much the same consistency as everything else.  If you are looking to save a few bucks, get some steak, and maybe load up on juices I'd say you can come here.  But for me, I think I'll spend a little more time trying to find a better eat in the Fremont Experience.

Told the lady at the counter that my kid had just eaten McDonalds and wasn't going to eat, but the cow still charged me $25 for her buffet. That's $25 for a cup of tap water because that's what my daughter had.

I on the other hand, ate my weight in crab legs. The rest of the food is bland. But I only came for the crab legs so I guess that's ok. Only bad thing is that they don't have crab leg crackers so I will be promptly seeing my dentist after tonight's dinner. Also, they used to split the crab legs in half for you before, so there was no need for crab crackers, but not anymore. Now you're left to wrestle the crab legs between your teeth. 

My server was awesome. The food (with exception of the crab legs) not so much. Prob the last time I come here.

Good buffet for a reasonable cost. My husband and I ate for $23.79 drinks included. Salad, soup, fruit, build your own burger, lots of desserts and frozen yogurt and a sampling of many other things. Atmosphere is neat and waitress was very nice. It was a good find for a buffet. Sorry we missed the mimosa included breakfast!

Excellent quality & selections for the price! We came in a Thursday & steak grilled to order was on the buffet. It was tender & cooked well - better than I expected for a buffet. I had raw oysters, a pretty good beef manicotti & baked potato with all the toppings. Pretty great pie selection & soft serve frozen yogurt. I would come here again!

Came here for free on a comp, so I can't really complain. It is a lower tier buffet, and Vegas probably has much better to offer.

Join their players club and gamble a little to get some free comps to this place. I'm not sure if I would buy my meal ticket into here.

However, they have good prime rib and usually that is what I eat here.
I came here during the Thanksgiving Holiday. Had a steak with the buffet....the steak was good. the buffet was ok.

For $16.95 this was not the worst buffet I have ever had in Vegas - but it certainly wasn't anything to come back to. With the exception of a few decent dishes - this was pretty much at the Hometown Buffet level of food. However - there was snow crab legs and cold shrimp - which saved it. 

The Chinese food here is not good. The carving station was okay. The breakfast dishes looked good but I did not try them.

There was only one soup.
The smallest buffet ever. Such a waste of time and money. Wish we had just waited hour and a half at Caesar's Palace...

Me and my boyfriend were visiting Fremont street and got hungry.  We had been spending ridiculous amount of money on strip food so this place seemed like a real bargain.  I kinda liked the decor.  It was an 80's jungle theme.  Our server was very nice and attentive. Most of the food was not very good.  I got quite a few items that I only took 1 or 2 bites of. I think it's funny that they advertised it was a steak dinner buffet and what they served was thin strips of  carne asada.  It was still yummy though.  Just not what I picture when I think of steak.  To get full I had to make 10 trips to the carving station, they are very stingy with the meat. Bottom line- I didn't get sick, I got full and it was really cheap. Would I go back? No.

My husband and I agree, best buffet Downtown! The hotel is crap, but the buffet is great!  The cafe is just as good if you don't want to do the "buffet thing". BLT is to die for! Make sure you make a stop here to eat while you are experiencing Freemont Street! http://www.fremontcasino.com/dining/paradise-buffet-and-cafe

Thumbs up!
Didn't do the buffet breakfast as the food didn't look good.  What was good is the hawaiian style lokomoco breakfast!  It was good and not expensive.  Best thing was the service was quick.

Seafood buffet on Tuesday's and Fridays. Indian casino buffets are better but it's downtown Las Vegas and we get discount coupons.  The discount validates paying for this buffet.  There's the typical buffet stations, salad, mexican, American, prime rib, desserts and also dishes that cater to the local hawaiians who frequent downtown.

We tried the Friday night seafood buffet, which seemed like a better deal than the other ones on Fremont St. We also got another dollar discount for joining the players club at the casino. 

The cracked crab and oysters on the half-shell were outstanding, and we definitely got our 21 bucks worth on that alone. Both were seeet and fresh. However, the rest of the buffet was not very good. The fried foods were overcooked and tasteless, sushi was nasty, desserts were generally disgusting, even the stuff they didn't make there, like eclaires, were dry and inedible. 

I would say - if you are a big fan of crab and oysters, go for it. Eat nothing else but big piles of shellfish. Get your money's worth of those, then leave. I had five plates of crab and at least a dozen oysters! Avoid the rest.

This is the buffet in the Freemont. We had breakfast there which was the normal buffet fare--meats, fruits, biscuits and gravy, some sweets and eggs. Pretty standard, nothing out of the ordinary. 

Psst! Hey! I'll tell you a little secret that we found out from a transplanted local....You don't have to wait for the middle of the night to get Oxtail soup at the Cal. Paradise Cafe offers it all day long. Lots of meat, great flavor, and a pretty big bowl. So when you go to the buffet, instead of getting in line for the buffet, ask to go to the Cafe. It's located way in the back, and you eat off a menu. Skip the line by taking the express lane on the right, and they will seat you right away.

lets start with you get what you pay for...... 
the fremont advertises all the great food they have in their various restarants however they dont tell you where it is... so we thought we were going to a prime rib buffet which wasnt the case..... we were sat... the waiter/helper of the drinks... whatever you want to call him, obviously hated life.... I can live with that.... the food.... yeah ayce sushi... dryed out... the crab legs, too small to even get meat out of. The crab claws? overcooked to the point the meat was more like leather. The oysters? too small to eat.. The enchiladas? stoffers does better, HOWEVER the self serve Ice cream was ok :)

20 dollar cab ride from strip. what the eff why is downtown vegas so far?

um walking through the casino is just depressing. but trekked through it to find a brunch buffet with endless champagne for 10.99. that ended at 3 yes. 10.99 but expect 10.99 

you will get champagne and orange juice separately - so get creative on how you build your mimosas. stay a while- enjoy the flowing champagne and feel the age around you......

Don't be fooled by the false and negative reviews on this place. I've eaten here twice and will constantly go back.

I enjoy buffets immensly. I think it's the idea that I can keep going back to try many things all for one price and I know that that's why I enjoy The Paradise Buffet so much.

First of all, the place is dirt cheap, even by Vegas standards. 8 dollars for lunch anywhere is pretty good, but in Sin City, it's an outright steal. Plus, it's cheaper than Hometown Buffet, slightly more gourmet, and best of all, void of annoying children running around eating nothing but jello and pudding.

While the selection is a little on the low side, the food is actually quite good. The roast beef was rare and flavorful, the mashed potatoes were thick and fluffy, the salad bar was full of green, fresh lettuce and a great variety of toppings for it. They even have an option for your own burgers and hot dogs. 

The atmosphere is defiantly jaded (but so is most of old town Vegas) and yes the waiters/waitresses seem to be on the tired side, but those are things I can easily overlook when it comes to cheap, tasty buffets. You can spend 35 dollars on a buffet at the Wynn or you can drive 5 minutes up to Fremont and have lunch for next to nothing...and keep all that extra money to win big on their cheap tables.

We ate twice here we came both days about 11am one day we had breakfast and the second day we had a lunch.
Its a good buffet for a very affordable price its about 11$ per person.
They service variety of food All-American,  Italian and Mexican.
There is a big selections of desserts even sugar free.
One of the dishes I loved it was the chicken breast, Italian style,  fried rice, salad and pecan pie.

If you have recently escaped from prison and would like food that tastes similar to what you have been eating in prison, be sure to stop by for some mystery meat surprise at this zero star buffet. My relatives talked me into going here and now I will have to disown them! Seriously disappointing food. The worst part is that I paid almost twenty dollars to possibly get food poisoning! I should have taken pictures of the food, it was so gross. If you happen to find yourself here after reading this review- the tacos, nachos and some sort of green stew in the Mexican section were semi-palatable. The fried chicken was also good. I really have no idea how a buffet could be so terrible but I just don't think that they buy anything about Grade F. The prime rib was laughable and the steaks were like small pieces of shoe leather. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!

Came here today for the Crab Legs and Shrimp Seafood Buffet Night.  

We were still indecisive if we wanted to go here or the Village Seafood Buffet at the Rio.

It was a decent buffet and we had no issues with it.  

Server was efficient and clear our table of the dirty plates on a timely matter.

Crab Legs were good overall.   I ate a ton of this today.  3 platefuls.  No complaints whatsoever.  But some people might be expecting top tier crab legs or something and be disappointed when they go here......not me.  The crag legs are not cut in half, you do have to work for them.

Got my money's worth and then some. 

Dessert selections were decent and my wife liked them.   

I got some hot food selections to eat too, not too shabby. 

Again, we were happy and satisfied by coming here today.  No complaints.

We've been to the more expensive buffets on the strip which have more selections and choices, but if you were eating crab legs like I do most of the time...then this is a wise spot to go when it's served on Tuesday & Friday Nights.    

Otherwise, if you want a huge selections of choices such as street tacos, ethnic foods such as asian foods, large selection of fruits......go to the pricier buffets on the strip.
Worst good I've ever attempted to eat. Horrible service, horrible food. Don't risk getting sick.

Surprisingly, I haven't heard much about the oxtail soup here. Not until a friend from Hawai'i who was in town said she heard this is THE place to get the best oxtail soup in Vegas. We'll see. Btw... when rating oxtail soup, I'm spoiled with homemade Jamaican Oxtail Stew. Stew over soup all the way. 

Okay, before I get into the oxtail, come here for the cafe NOT the buffet. 

The buffet is gross and it has limited selection. PLUS, the cafe line is shorter. If you're looking for a buffet in DTLV go to Main Street. If Main Street has a long line (usually Fridays for crab legs, get there before they open, if i'm not mistaken dinner opens at 4pm) If the line is long there, go check out the DTLV restaurants outside of the casino area. New and delish spots opening up. :-) They're walking distance. 

TIP: Usually there's a line and wait at The Cal's cafe (Market Street Cafe), so come here if you want Oxtail soup. 

The oxtail soup bowl - Comparing to The Cal's... Paradise Cafe's has a larger serving for a regular size, the photo doesn't do it justice! More oxtail, more vegetables, nuts (nice touch), more cilantro and green onions. It comes with a side of ginger and two scoops of rice. In some ways it is better. Larger portions. 

Oxtail is good during cooler months, but when it's warm out...the sandwiches & local food are the way to go. Reuben was packed with corned beef but it needed more sauerkraut & sauce. Comes with salt & pepper fries. Flavor and quality is not like the deli but it's decent. For Hawai'ian cafes that serve Reuben's I still prefer The Cal's. 

2017 Yelp Challenge Review #3

Really great food for the price . Totally old school Vegas prices . I was there on steak night . They had a cook grilling up steaks to order and they were very good. I was shocked to also find crab legs and sushi . The crab legs look small and you have to crack them yourself but they were juicy and amazing. I couldn't belive its only 15 dollars with players card . Way better then Bellaigo and half the cost .

Service here is terrible! Went to the cafe and got seated by the kitchen. Could overhear all the staff bitching and complaining. My favorite was the guy overheard saying "I don't like no sorry ass motherfuckers" several times. I had to ask for a drink refill because the waiter didn't think an empty cup needed to be tended to. He also didn't do separate checks as we requested from the beginning, and seemed irritated when I asked him to separate them at the end. 

The food was ok.

Fremont has a wonderful hidden treasure in the back of their casino, their Paradise Buffet. It's small but reasonably priced and offers a fine selection of food. No real surprises, it's what's become the standard buffet lineup of entrees, an omelet/pancake station, and southwestern and Chinese dishes. Sunday Brunch offers some extra seafood (shrimp, crab) and champagne. It's not the good stuff, but believe me, after a glass or two you won't notice.

I was lucky enough to visit champagne brunch with a group of frinds who also like to play with their food. The buffet selection inspired me to assemble a southern-style plate of fried chicken and waffles with a side of fruit that tasted divine. Then I hit the dessert bar. Again, nothing fancy here, but a nice array of cakes and pies with soft serve ice cream also available. Extra credit to the buffet for offering sugar free pies and cake as well.

The best thing about the Paradise Buffet may be the decor. It has the darker feel of classic Vegas casinos, but there is an attempt at tropical lushness with plastic greenery and flowers throughout and a large aquarium at the entrance. The buffet is set off by crystal-accented chandeliers and lighting, the ceiling is all mirrored tile. Liberace would've been right at home here - and I mean that in the best way possible.

One star off my rating for a poor first impression: the restrooms are at the entry and they may be the first thing you smell coming in from the casino. But once you're over that speedbump, it's all good.

We were staying near here and my mom wanted the prime rib buffet. The inside of this restaurant is very eclectic and very green(think 80's paradise). We were seated right away and then they wheeled me to the trough. JK- but I did go up and see what awaited. I tried almost everything, and really the selection was really open. I had cold cuts and cheese, I did try the sushi and I was surprised to like it as much as I did. I don't know if it was made on site or not but it tasted fresh so I did get that a few times. I did not like the prime rib, nor did my mom. It lacked flavor and was tough. The roast beef was great, there was breaded chicken that was good and really everything else was good. I am blanking on what else I ate but I know I had mashed potatoes, gravy, rice, a creamy chicken breast. I would eat here again for sure, I will say if the dessert you are choosing looks like plastic, it probably tastes like plastic. I think the area they need to improve on is the "pie" that is being offered.  There was a caramel pecan bar that was amazing I ate like 4 of them (what happens in Vegas...)

Definitely cliche, old-Vegas buffet; food quality wasn't bad, but the selection and atmosphere definitely leave something to be desired. 

The good: Nacho Cheese sauce, burger station, ribs and plenty of desserts. 

The bad: lack of great selection, flavorless hot dogs bloated by water, dark and dingy atmosphere, and terrible service.
Great weekend brunch for just over $10 a person. Crab claws, lox, prime rib, and champagne make this our go to place to cure our hangovers.

As far as second-tier buffets go, this one is pretty damn good. Of course, you will not be getting the gourmet food that is at the Wynn or the Bellagio, but for $11.99, this buffet is seriously not bad.  They even have a seafood section with crab legs!!!

We came here for Sunday Brunch and so there was breakfast and lunch foods.  I like this place because you can either order off the cafe menu if you don't feel like buffet, OR you can get buffet.  Most of our group went with the buffet but I ordered off the menu.  

I can still rate the buffet though, because I pretty much ordered my BF around and ate half of his food. hahaha.  Biscuits & gravy...YUM....the bacon was YUM...the cornbeef hash was YUMMMM.   I ended up ordering the oxtail soup (where my hawaiians at?) which is SOOOOO good here.  Better than at the other downtown hotels.

Just the worst. The front of house staff was nice enough but the food was terrible. The kitchen staff obviously does not care about the restaurant or customers. There was liquid all over the seats. Everything on the hot buffet was cold. The ribs and shrimp were both room temperature. I assume that they were hot when put on the buffet line, but had sit long enough without proper heating that they had enough time to get down to room temperature throughout. Room temp meats are a breeding ground for bacteria that causes food poisoning. My husband and I each took a few bites of our food and decided that we'd prefer not to get Norovirus or Listeria on vacation. I would have raised my concerns with management but couldn't find a manager.

Great staff, quieter environment, food for the price is fine. Only three buffets to speak of, and for the price, i enjoy this one too. Had one of their steaks. Rubbery, over cooked, awful. Everything else was ok.

Best buffet in Vegas?  Probably not, but a damn good value with pretty decent food.  We ate here a couple times - simply because we were gambling all night and got comped a lot. :)  BUT, we found the food to be quite tasty and the champagne made us feel like the high-rollers that we kinda were those nights...  It was a great feeling to cut in front of the line with our vouchers and go right in.  

The prime rib was very good, but the ham was amazing.  It was fun to sample a little bit of everything, but it's hard to not keep ringing the prime rib bell when given the chance.  I didn't mess with the desserts much.  The fruit was fresh and had good flavor - something I always worry about with buffets.

dont eat here !!!
if there were zero stars that would  be my rating !! almost didnt even order after looking at crappy menu  but since it was late and my daughter was  starving i gave in. ordered country fried steak w mashed potatoes and "vege of the day" that turned out to be frozen  jolly green giant style corn w watery instant mashed potatoes and an overcooked  frozen patty of some type of who knows  what. within minutes of taking 4 -5 bites my stomach started cramping . i first was trying to stay positive and thought " maybe because we didnt eat all day" took a couple more bites and the cramps got worse thats when i knew something wasnt right. stopped eating and continued to be sick all night into today . it was def the food. my daughter had soup and was fine . which is a damn good thing for their sake . i will be filing a complaint with the state tonight

Went to Vegas and had to try a buffet... unfortunately I ended up going to dinner late so I had to find a buffet place that stays open a bit later than the others (why do buffets end so early in Vegas?!!) located in downtown Las Vegas, I liked the fact that I got to check out downtown Las Vegas but I was really disappointed with the food.

I found this one after doing some digging and searching, the price was decent for a dinner buffet but then I realized why... the food was not up to standards and I don't think I found one piece of food that I enjoyed there or liked.

We were in Vegas back in April and decided to hit this buffet for their seafood night, specifically the crab legs.

Being from Seattle, I should have known better.

Skinny, overcooked snow crab legs with very little meat.  And if you're not going to provide any crab cracking utensils, at least score the shells!  And since they were overcooked, nearly impossible to remove from the shells.  I hate wasting anything that comes from a living creature but I didn't have much choice.  Rest of the food was bland and boring - no better than Old Country Buffet, but at twice the price.

I see that Brent H.'s review below raves about the crab legs, but clearly you've never had fresh Pacific NW dungeness crab - you'd forget all about these skinny little critters.  I guess I'm spoiled, so I won't be going back to this buffet.

So my friends and I were a little off the strip to check out the amazing Golden Nugget pool, and we came across this buffet.

We came on a Saturday night, which was like steak night? I ended up paying ~$20 for dinner-- which wasn't bad.

The interior was like a dark rain forrest. I guess that was the theme?

As for the food, it was decent. It wasn't the besttttest, but it was good. I really enjoyed how the chef cooked their steaks -- on the spot! However, if you like it medium-- GO FOR MEDIUM RARE, just because they tend to overcook it. The sushi selection was limited, BOO TO THAT. As for the rest, it was alright. I did enjoy the PECAN PIE DESSERT -- AHHHH HEAVEN. There was also KING CRAB LEGS AND FRESH OYSTERS. So yay for that. Oh, and they also have smoked salmon-- which was fairly interesting.

As for the service, it was decent; however, I did not enjoy when the waitress took my plate FULL OF KING CRAB LEGS, that wasn't touched :( What a waste of food. Oh, and there were these little flies that were constantly around my plate, which is why I marked one star down. I was definitely a little irritated with these flies-- hopefully they fix this insect problem!

Overall, it was a decent buffet. I wouldn't mind coming back if I was in the area.

Turn Ons:
-STEAK!
-PECAN PIE!

Turn Offs:
-Small flies were always around my plate.

Decided to go here because we were on Fremont St. & saw a sign that said biggest & best buffet.....ok so let's try it.  Never again.  It wasn't horrible, but I won't come back again.  The place was dark and had a bunch of fake greenery which kinda made me feel (in my opinion) like I was in a dingy loungy place, which didn't really make my food appetizing.  The only decent food I liked was the candied yams- very sweet but good.  Everything else....was meh.  Not the biggest buffet I've seen (what a total lie) & certainly not the best.  The buffet bar was small- not alot of selection in my opinion.  They have mirrors all around to make the place look bigger.  I didn't eat much cause I didn't like the food & the atmosphere didn't really appeal to me.

Definitely worth it. Went on Sea food night. And from how the cashier put it 85% of the buffet is Seafood lol. Its delicious. The server is on point and keeps your table cleared and drinks replenished. The stations are well stocked and when it gets low they quickly top it off. Whether it be the salad station or anything else. The peel and eat shrimp was good. I didnt have crab legs but they were split in half and looked kind of small. 

Roast beef was delicious and have no complaints. Between this or Golden Nugget from what i read about their buffet i would save a few bucks and come here.
Don't waste your time. We came here on prime rib night and the selection was awful. What they did have wasn't worth eating. Lunch meat on a buffet? The best part was my soft serve ice cream

Tuesday Seafood Buffet
Dungeon and Snow Crab........so good!  Perfect timing!
This what I imagine prison food would be like. The Mt.Dew was cold, the only redeeming quality of this review. It's what earned the two star.
Signage all says open until 11pm. We go to the cashier at 9:30pm and she informs us they are closing. What kind of restaurant turns away people wanting to pay. Stupid as it gets.

Very disgusting and poorly made food. I've been here for breakfast and dinner and honestly, I've had higher quality meals from tacobell. I would NOT recommend unless you hate yourself and want to punish your body with a terrible meal.

Blah, that's my impression. Been here a few times when family comes in from Hawaii, they get coupons to eat here, so we will come along. Today, it was very bland, nothing stood out as exceptional and everything seemed to taste the same. I don't know if it was me, but I didn't want to go back for more. The quality has certain gone down hill.

This buffet was pretty gross. Nothing seemed fresh, we didn't see our waiter at all from the time to hostess sat us, meaning no extra napkins or any beverages. The food looked as if it had been sitting there all day, and there was a weird looking film on all if the fruit. I wouldn't trust going there again, or recommend it at all. We should have just gone back to the Garden Court buffet at the station. Now that place is good!

Went there on the Sunday  "seafood" buffet. Great price for a "seafood" buffet. But what exactly makes a buffet a "seafood" buffet??? The Rio hotel has a "seafood" buffet which is about twice the cost of this buffet... But for a good reason - it has hot and cold crab, lobster, fresh juicy oysters, sushi, sashimi, and the list goes on...

The Paradise "Seafood" Buffet is nothing more than a standard buffet with fresh oysters and about 3 kinds of sushi added to the menu! It is pretty standard for most buffets to include shrimp and crab legs in their dinner menus. So I suppose if you add some oysters and some sushi in your menu, you're magically upgraded to "Seafood" Buffet!

Whoever was in charge of the oysters when I went, didn't rinse them so there was a ton of barnicle pieces and black oyster shell goo all over the place. To makes matters worse, they also stacked the oysters all on top of each other, so you'd be sure to taste some of that crunchy shell pieces and goo. Yumm? The oysters themselves were quite good, but the poor preparation lead me to only eat less than a handfull of them. In comparison, I think I ate about two dozen juicy ones at the Rio. As for the sushi... I think it was just a california roll, a shrimp nigiri, and tuna roll. 

So if you're a seafood aficionado, then be ready to be disappointed. If you're a regular buffet eater... Not bad!

It's not that I hate or don't like this buffet, but it is very average to me. After eating the foods they had elsewhere, I know the quality in particular is pretty meh. At the same time, the assortment of food and the fact that its a buffet does give it good value.

On the night my family and I went, the tilapia was mushy yet somehow rubbery and I can't quite rationalize that one. The prime rib was quite tough and my medium rare steak was well done on the top half and rare on the bottom half. Everything else was okayish--nothing that tasted extraordinary but nothing absolutely horrible.

One thing I wonder about is the dim lighting. I was a bit uncomfortable and it felt odd. I had never dined in someplace so dim before and what makes me uncomfortable is that I like to see the food, what I'm eating in each bite and the state of the cleanliness of the eatery. It would definitely have gen the restaurant a more comfortable atmosphere if it was brighter, but not too bright.
I give this place 3 starts for pricing and value. For the pice I guess the food couldn't be that much more quality or a selection but all in all not bad.

After check in the wife and I were hungry so decided to check it out. We're not buffet fans but for speed and selection we thought we would give it a try. Price was high ($25) due to it being seafood night (overcooked crab and boiled shrimp). Both of us understand that it is hit and miss on a buffet and we tried a little of everything. Unfortunately, we couldn't find a hit. All the entrees were horrible. The carrot cake and soda were good. It might have been a bad night or my poor taste as we went early (5:15) and still waited 15 minutes and when we left, the line was out the door and through the casino. Maybe others know something I don't. My opinion, try somewhere else.

I've been here a half dozen times or so, mostly because it's pretty inexpensive.  If you're looking to fill up after a long day of pressing the slot machine "spin" button, you should probably give it a shot.  The champagne brunch is worth the price, and the servers I've had have all been fast and generous with the mimosas.  

There's probably not a single item on the buffet that you'll "need" to go back for, but as far as overall value for your dollar, it's hard to beat.  

I'll go back.  More than once.

Alright those four stars are purely for the 40 champagne refills our servers didn't hesitate to dole out. Thank you, thank you, thank you- I truly appreciate a brunch buzz.  The food on the other had well what can you expect for 11 bucks all you can eat and chugg? They did have the coveted buffet crab legs and shrimp and salad bar. I didn't eat any red meats but the people I ate with seemed pleased. There was a sweet lookin omelette making station for those so inclined. Basically if your going for the champagne you'll be pleased.

If you take a plate of breakfast potatoes, au gratin potatoes, and vegetable chow mein, then you cover the whole thing in melted  butter, what do you get?  You get the reason why the terrorists hate America... 

The place was clean, the service was decent, and the food choices was what I expected for a downtown LV casino buffet: ordinary and plentiful.

But the large vat of melted butter?  You can put that sh*t on everything!

Fair price for the food. Of course it is not up to the standards of the top tier buffets at the premium strip hotels costing 3-4 times more money.

I wanted lots of fruit for breakfast as I eat a plethora of beef the previous day. The breakfast buffet is a bargain. There was plenty of fruit but some of it not quite ripe, some was pretty good.  For the breakfast buffet, there is an omelet station and pastry case.

There's the usual bacon, scrambled eggs, corn beef hash, pancakes, ham, waffles, cereal, sausage. They also include drinks of choice and I had orange juice, tomato juice and coffee... That alone would cost as much as the $8 I paid for the buffet at most restaurants. I had an omelet as well, so the buffet was a good value for me.

If you want an egg white only omelet, you can get it here... Cannot comment on their lunch or dinner spreads/value.

If I could give it zero stars I would...  Thought me and my family were going to have a good lunch but at 1230 everything was still breakfast.  The only thing that was even slightly okay was the bread... and it was almost rock hard. We left just as hungry as we went in.. I will NEVER go here again and I recommend anywhere but this place.

Tuesday and Friday nights are seafood nights. All for the "low, low price" of $31.38. Perfect as we thought we'd miss out on a seafood buffet visiting Monday through Thursday, cause all the buffets we checked had the seafood usually on Friday, Saturday, and Sunday.

Seafood included Dungeness crab (cold and hot), cold was better, cause hot, wasn't, and was overly salted. Cold was just fine tho, with the shells cut for easy opening. There were also raw oysters, boiled shrimp. Fried oysters, shrimp, calamari, and clams. There were also snow crab. The New England clam chowder was too salty. If you got there early enough, you got to try their delicious cooked clams.   The was a small selection of sushi. Carved roast beef with au jus, fresh or creamy horseradish other fixings. Fixings to make you own tacos. Meatballs and spaghetti. The was a full salad bar with a good variety for fresh items. Dessert was the typical variety of pies and pastries. Key lime pie was nice. Fresh fruit was limited to cantaloupe and honeydew slices. The self serve ice cream was very creamy and a nice end to a satisfying meal.

Staying on the strip, this place is a bargain.  Expect 80's Hawaiian theme d buffet with aunties as your server.  Server was very friendly and especially kind to my little boy.  Went on a seafood day but they don't offer it for lunch.  The salad bar was great but the hot food was kinda limited.  They did offer prime rib which was ok, nothing stood out.  Had pecan pie that wasn't sweet at all.  All in all worth it for lunch but don't have high standards.  Its a true old school, cheap buffet.

This buffet took me back to the 80's and not in a good way. I was having flashback of the Golden Girls. The place seriously hasn't been remodeled since then. I went there late at night and my husband and I were both drunk and usually everything tastes great when we are drunk but not this time. My husband ended up eating a plate of mashed potatoes because he said he used to love the mashed potatoes that they served in high school and these reminded him of 
them. I ate two plates full of overly cooked, dried out prime rib. 
I think I'll just grab a hotdog the next time I am downtown.

O yes,, the food and service here is good, fast seating and read to eat,, for me the best food so far,, hands down,, I will recommend this place to every one I know is coming to Vegas, and  I will be back, an this will be my spot to eat,, oh..and the price is great..
Rock hard bread sticks, bland meats, and I don't think this is the paradise you're looking for...

Meh is right.  Although the price is low, it is barely edible.  The cold cuts and salad bar are downright gross.  There is very limited choice, maybe 9 dishes plus a carving station, small salad and cold cut bar, nachos, and a make your own burger and hot dog station.  This would be a great idea if the dogs and burgers were made fresh for you but instead they sit rotting in a warmer and are always over cooked and rubbery.  I have yet to get a fresh roll here.  Their specialty dishes are usually good however and I enjoy their fried chicken even though it may have come from the smallest bird ever and the staff behind the counter don't seem to care that I want a thigh and look at me like I am crazy.  My former boss used to take me here every now and then or I would have never gone back.

If you like cheap buffets, this is one but for the same price Red Rock has much better food and more quantity.

The Paradise Buffet is decent, the food is good, nothing spectacular, but good.  I realized after I ate here that they go to this buffet in the movie Swingers,(one of my favorite movies).  There are a lot of different options the prime rib is good, pizza was good, and fajita steak good.  I passed on some of the fruit and salad.  Made a meatball sub here, tasted like Subway meatballs.  The desserts were ok, soft serve ice cream was good.  Our waiter checked on us maybe twice throughout our dinner, not very helpful. It maybe a little outdated, but I enjoyed eating here, was a fun experience

3.5 stars.

A buffet is a quintessential Vegas experience, and as someone who isn't a huge fan of buffets, I think Paradise is a good spot to come for lunch. It's under $10 with tax, server (for drinks) was friendly, and the food was pretty decent.

Started off with a huge salad which is kind of hard to mess up. Onto the entrees, the food seemed fresh and was kept nice and hot. Loved the teryaki chicken with white rice and steamed pork buns (although the paper on the pork buns stuck to the bottom so that was a bit of a challenge). Waffle fries were good and crispy but not that hot. Soft service ice cream for dessert with all the sundae fixings was also yummy!

I'm giving this buffet a high rating because we experienced excellent and fresh seafood especially the crab legs. We actually stumbled across this place after riding "slotzilla" (zip line) down Fremont St. 
They only serve the seafood buffet on Thursdays and Sundays for about $26 per person. The restaurant itself is clean. The staff were friendly and the buffet is well stocked with plenty of food....especially the crab. I highly recommend this buffet if your in the mood for great tasting fresh crab.

It's  very unfair to rate this place 3 stars.  First, there are so many buffets in Vegas.  Second, downtown buffets are different from those on the Strip.  Next there are stand alone buffet restaurants.  You would not compare a BMW 7 series with the 5 series and conclude that the 5 sires is substandard.

That said, Paradise buffet deserve a 4.5 stars in its own class: downtown and price.  In my opinion, it's the best.  If you are willing to drive to downtown, this is the place to have buffet.  Parking can be a little difficult but  you can find a parking structure with 4 hours validation in the casino.  With price conscious people, every dollar counts.  This buffet offers many varieties:  mainstream American: meat and potatoes, Italian: pizza, pasta, Mexican: enchilada, taco, Asian: sushi, fried rice, etc.  They are all good, not exceptional.  Oh, dessert is also good.  Service is efficient.  Walk out to the bar right outside and get a $1.00 beer .  Bring it in.  The price for the buffet depends on theme night: Friday for seafood, certain day for prime rib but regular night is around $12.00.  The wait depends on season and certain day and time.  You can call to check.  What else do you  want?

My husband and I decided last minute to go to Fremont St, and we hadn't really planned where we wanted to go for dinner. We stumbled upon this buffet and decided to give it a try.

Bleh. It really wasn't good. Inside is dark and dingy, and the selection of food reminded me of  a gross high school cafeteria. Most of the food that I tried was awful. This place needs a major rehab and an improved menu. There was a weird smell in the place too.

The only redeeming factors were the price - it was like 17$ per person, which wasn't bad...and the fried chicken LOL. It was seriously so good - it's pretty much all I ate at this place since everything else wasn't good.

Don't go out of your way to come here, there are better places to eat.

This is not the best place to eat in Old vegas. The buffet tops were dirty, they barely had food ready, and the food that was ready was cold or half cooked and hard. They also over charge for a buffet that had absolutely no sea food, only shrimp. And there were hardly any waitresses to help get your drinks. Of course the ice cream machine was down and the food was not flavorful at all. It was a pretty gruesome experience.

This place is so lousy!  Just about everything is dried up. I had the scalloped potatoes which most likely came out of a box. Eck!!  The mashed potatoes were in a big clump.I even put gravy on those things and it still didn't come apart!!   All 3 meats at carving station were overly well done. Nothing can save those meats.
  The seafood salad was ok although they put big chunks of red onion in it so when you bite into it all you taste is a harsh onion.  
  The fried chicken actually was somewhat moist with a good crunchy skin.
   Never will I ever eat here again

Went on Tuesday for the $20 seafood buffet. The only three things worth mentioning are snow crab claws, crawfish, and steamed shrimp. Come here if you want to eat endless amounts of the aforementioned. Everything else is crap.

First off Im not a HUGE buffet person since Im not only very picky but i just dont really eat alot. So with that said I decided to order from the Menu. Initally i thought the menu was going to be a good size with atleast a couple of good options for me(vegetarianish) but it didnt so i ended going with the Fried Shrimp w/ vegetables and Fries. Which made me a little upset because im not a fried food kind of gal but it was really one of the only things the had for me. I got my food and instantly I knew that it was from a bag/frozen food!!!! IM SORRY BUT NO! This was so nasty and ugh for $12.99 i couldve made this @ home. The only reason I give this place the two stafs is because our waitress Linda was a GEM!! A heart of gold and really did her best to accomadate with me. And the Atmosphere was nice

***Attention Attention Attention ***
