I can only say that, if you want to go to this place, take care of your stuff because they have skillfully thief employee and steal your cellphone or bag and there is no camera that you can prove it.please Believe me, my boyfriend and I went to this damn buffet for breakfast, and when we left the table to bring our breakfast, no one as a costumer was around and only employees and I left my phone confidently on the table, and after two minutes, when I returned, they stole my cellphone and I knew exactly which employee did it. So We couldn't eat anything.

Eventually, the restaurant's management came and she was really relax and indifferent, it seems that every second one cellphone is lost and she didn't even apologize (I think in this buffet it's so common).Summary of the last day of our holiday was very sucked in that city. 

Perhaps this would have been acceptable if it occurred at the downtown but incredible in this hotel and restaurant.

Please, Please, those who Read this to know even the price of this buffet is expensive for nothing, it's not wort it. Don't waist your time, money and cellphone.

Not the fanciest, or the best buffet in Las Vegas.........but there is a lot to be said about the Paradise Buffet & Cafe Restaurant inside the Fremont Hotel.

My mom & dad like to stay at the Fremont hotel for some reason, and a lot of times that they come here, they dine at the Paradise Buffet & Cafe Restaurant.

The buffet at the Paradise Buffet & Cafe Restaurant is not the biggest, nor do they have the largest food selection. What I can say is that this buffet is clean, has pretty good service, and they do make one thing that I really love...........the FRIED CHICKEN!!!

When I do go here to eat, I always make sure that they are serving Fried Chicken that day. Ummmmm........Fried Chicken! What can I say............they know how to do it right! 
Big Meaty pieces of chicken, fried to perfection, & seasoned just right! If I could eat this everyday without any health ramifications.........I'd do it! :) Lol!

Whatever you do avoid this buffet! We went here on a Friday night, "Seafood" night, WAY WAY WAY over priced, the food was not very good at all looks like it sitting there for hours and when asked the staff is there any fresher foods coming out, their reply "Nope not until that is all gone first" I mean seriously? That is discussing! When asked when we paid to go if it was worth the price and of course they say "yes, its very good" Boy they are lying! Also really your going to try and sweep up around my feet when I am trying to get food. That is rude and nasty, the food was poor quality and cold, and not very presentable. Boyd Gaming really needs to thing about this property's buffet, I mean maybe they should close this one down. They had a small small selection, the staff is not very sanitary, they seem to wipe things on their clothes then handle your drinks. I will never again go here again and suggest anyone thinking about it, AVOID it, definitely NOT worth the price they charge!

dude, i love this place. we always eat here because we always stay at fremont, and while the hotel is nothing to rave about, the paradise cafe totally IS. i love this place more than the other cafes in vegas because they have these chill, really attentive hawaiian women working there and i swear, i see the same ones every year when I'm there. so they must be pretty damn happy to work there, which makes me happy to eat there. additionally, the food is really good and cheap. i always only order breakfast, so if the buffet sucks i'm sorry, but the chicken fried steak and eggs, or protcho and eggs, or NY steak and eggs.... ALL G. and the best part?? their TOAST!! a good toast with my breakfast really makes me happy

Food was alright. Got a few items and went back for more but they did away with them and said they stopped making it. They replaces cheese manicotti with meat and it tasted like I ate a spoonful of salt. They didn't have much to choose from and the items I tried were very salty. Very simple dessert bar too. Tastes like any other pie or cake from the market with the icing that is overloaded with sugar and is heaped on way too much.

The only reason we came here was because 1) it was a comp and 2) they had seafood Tuesday's serving snow crab. 

Much of everything else was mehhhh. Their garlic clams were very good, and I stuck with the snow crab the rest of my meal. The cold snow crabs were sooooooooooo goooooood. I don't know if they salted them, but some were a bit too salty. 

Either way, I had a blast and stuffed my face really well, and the fact that it was free, I can't complain. Now the true verdict is whether I would pay to eat here. If I'm stuck on eating snow crabs, I don't think it's a bad deal. Service was prompt.

After sitting at the tables for 2 hours we lost track of time and decided get a late bite. Came to this buffet and to our dismay it closes at 10.. it was 10 05. What kinda place in vegas closes at 10. Isnt this the city that never sleeps? Wtf. Spend all my money at the tables and come to eat and its closed. And the women at the cashiers station are awfully rude. Was unaware that another part of the restaurant was open and before leaving another guest told us the (cafe) was open its located towards the back of the restaurant.  Overall get workers that appreciate their jobs and have better customer service people.
Unhappy guest.

We were searching for a place to hold our family reunion that would accommodate a group of around 16 people and give us the food options that we wanted. It was suggested that we check out the Paradise Buffet since others had had good experiences making reservations. I called more than a month ahead but was told that they would not be able to take our reservation because it was Memorial Day weekend, but if we showed up at 4, when they opened, they would be able to seat us together. There would also be an 18% gratuity added automatically. So I said okay, let's do it. 
Our group of 16 showed up slightly before 4. The woman at the register didn't even look up from what she was doing to curtly inform us that the buffet didn't open until 4. We let her know that we just wanted to let them know that we were going to have a large group and wanted to sit together and would pay on the same check. She said we could just wait in line and they'd see what they could do. Grrr...
At four, we all went through the line and I paid for the 16 people (we had collected the money previously.) The total came out to more than I had expected but I brushed it off, thinking that my math had been off somewhere. We were seated at four different tables in the same area, as each table could only hold between 6 and 8 people. 
The buffet wasn't anything special. We were there on their steak night, but the majority of the food was pretty buffet-standard. Pasta, mashed potatoes, chicken, vegetables, desserts, that sort of thing. But the food was good. 
It began bothering me that the price was more than $20 more than what I had expected it was going to be. So I decided to go to the register and ask for another print out of the receipt. When the cashier handed it to me, I found that they had charged me for 18 people, not 16. But they were nice when I brought it up, and were prompt in giving me a refund for those two non-existent people. 
I don't want to give them anything more than a three because it wasn't amazing. The service was okay, the food way okay, and if it hadn't been for that mistake with the payment, I probably would have given it a 4. I hope they're more careful in the future.

I was with a group and they walked in here so what the heck ! I was hungry. After all they filmed a scene from Swingers in here so maybe the Old Style Vegas Charm of this place would enchant me :) 

The food was not visually appealing but I managed to fix myself a descent looking plate. (see pic) Although it was not worth the price, I guess we were mostly paying for the prime rib which is a decent piece of meat for Old town Vegas. Adults and kids are both one price which is disappointing because all my son had was spaghetti and sauce. We've had much better buffets in Vegas but at least we tried something new somewhere old :)

Terrible terrible terrible. Do not eat here. 
Everything we tried was bad. The prime rib was paper thin, tasteless, and super rare. Pork chop  thin and tasteless. Deserts were bland. Sides limited and tasteless. Everything...just bad. Save your $ and stomach. Very small buffet too. Very limited choices.
I'm usually not this harsh but its true.
So small. Food is terrible. And overpriced...dont waste your time or money at this place i got the vibe of vegas vacation when i saw this slop.

This review is ONLY for their oxtail soup.

My husband is from Hawaii, so when we're in Vegas, he always craves the oxtail soup because only Vegas does oxtail soup like Hawaii. We can't find good ones in LA. He doesn't really eat rice and watch his diet, but man, when it comes to his oxtail soup, he just devours that soup and finishes his rice brutally. That how good it is!!!

This is an okay buffet.  The breakfast brunch offers a variety of breakfast and lunch options.  Eggs cooked to order, fresh carved meats and a sanwhich bar are nice options.  The mexican meat pie is pretty gross.  The crab claws and peel and eat shrimp could be better quality.  I tried the lox last time and coudn't swallow one bite.  With that being said, the local options of rice, corned beef hash and portuguese sausage are great.  The korean chicken is good.  My mom loved the fried chicken.  There is a nice blend of American and island options.  Overall not bad for the price.  If you are from the islands or receive specials from the hotel (or the chain) you get good discounts and coupons... which is why we are regulars here.

Yikes, no thank you!  I remember coming here as a teenager and loving it but I honestly think that my standards were a lot lower back then.  

The customer service was pretty good but the food was really bland and mediocre.  Thankfully the buffet didn't cost much compared to other Las Vegas buffets but I was so disappointed in the food.  They have a wide variety to choose from but in all honesty, I only enjoyed one thing: their fried chicken.  Their fried chicken is really tasty and crispy and everything else was just blah-even the dessert!

Cocktail Shrimp - really tiny shrimp
Meatloaf - no taste
Steak - hard and rubbery
Apple Pie - yuck
Pumpkin Pie - double yuck
Mashed Potatoes - very bland

Well, you get the picture.  

If you have a voucher for a free meal at the buffet, get the fried chicken, I don't know what else to tell ya.

Good and cheap! We came here for champagne brunch and I would definitely eat here again. It was worth the 10.99 based on their peel and eat shrimp and prime rib alone! The prime rib was so juicy and flavorful! They had creamy horseradish and au jus to go with it..blissful. They had crab claws that were good but very hard to extract meat from. They were pre-cracked so the server said they didn't have crackers :/ The champagne was good. Probably not fancy stuff but good. The servers never let my glass(plastic) be less than half full. Even if you drink one fourth they will top it off! Over all, I enjoyed everything I put on my plate except for some kind of white fish steak(too fishy).

Wow.  Worst dining experience I've had since a little buffet in Louisiana.  

Terrible old and dingy decor.  Our seats and tables were basically hosed down. It was all wet from someone "cleaning" it.  The buffet was scary and I thought I may get food poisoning, so I stayed away from all mayonnaise concoctions.  Prime rib was a dark brown - totally overcooked.  The condiments for baked potatoes were set-up before the utensils, not after the baked potatoes - so I had to go in reverse in the buffet.  Most of the selections were meat.  The salad bar, ugh...The vanilla ice cream was out and there was an array of drip bowls for dripping machine.  The shrimp were a strange orangey brown color and cocktail sauce was drizzled all over the bar.  There was a mess of serving spoons everywhere. The chicken was good.  But I picked a hair out of it. not even a decent dessert could appear here. My silverware was sticky to start.  The chocolate cake tasted like a recycled HoHo.  

The whole experience was simply awful. At $36.00 for two people, it's not even a deal.  

I am convinced all the other buffets on town ship their week old leftovers here to serve.

I feel bad for posting this because some of the servers were very sweet people and I can't imagine having to show up here everyday.  OMG.  Just an awful experience.

*  after reading some of these 3 - 4 - 5 star reviews, I'm really worried for some of my fellow Yelpers.  This place is dangerous.  I'd rather hand over my life savings to a drunk leprechaun dancing naked on a roulette table at O'Shea's than ever set foot NEAR this place again.

Exceptional Tropical Garden like experience.... loved it !! visited with my whole family... they have a palatable selection of American comfort food, Italian , Mexican food. Nice steak and pork ribs... a great selection of deserts.... salads... overall it is very reasonably priced too. Walk outside ... and you get the amazing Fremont Street experience... what else do you need !!

We needed some food and this was a convenient restaurant at yhe casino.   We didn't feel up for a buffet si we ordered sime sandwiches and iced tea off the menu.  The tea was fresh brewed and the sandwiches were good.  The service was kind of slow and the place was artic cold too.  A good late meal but take a sweater.

Took my boyfriend here for breakfast
The food was amazing
The staff was friendly
Love the ambiance
It was clean
The only thing i can recommend they do better is get a new recipe for macaroni and cheese. Everything was great except that
Also they have the coolest hamburger/hot dog station ever

We went to buffet after 9 hours drive to Vegas. And we were attracted to this buffet because of their price. It was $9.99 per person for dinner. I think their best is the Salmon and the Roast Beef. I had like 3 plates of Salmon haha...they were really good! They had a lot of chooses for the desserts but.. I didn't think they were that good. If you really want good Buffet I guess you would want to go to a more expensive buffet at the strip! if you just want something to fill you up then this place can definitely fill u up but not for the taste.

Let's be honest: we were on Fremont street, hungry, and didn't know where to go. We should have sought out more local people to ask!

Paradise buffet is good if you want that old-school, old-Vegas buffet experience. It's in a smoky casino, lots of older high rollers here, and your most boring buffet foods. (Think of any buffet you'd get at home: pizza, imitation Chinese, etc)

But the service was excellent and it was super cheap. So don't come expecting 5 stars and you're good to go! It will fill your tummy, that's for sure.

Seriously. To even consider this freemont St best restaurant is by far the biggest slap in the face I've ever encountered. The waitress who tended to us was very sweet and courteous. However, the host staff is horrendous. Seriously. They weren't there so we went to go sit down on our own as instructed and the host seriously screamed at us demanding we wait to be sat. He has no sense of personal service. 

I'm currently writing this review inside the paradise buffet and beginning to feel sick. We paid $22 for a buffet for two. While yes, this is relatively cheap compared to the better buffets on the strip, it's still A major rip off. We both ate one plate and left them completely full. Everything tastes straight out of the '90's and this isn't a taste too many people want. I know I don't. The recipes were bland and the kitchen staff were rude and not appreciative for the business  

The decor in this place is awful as well. Bland and dark. Just like their food. I highly recommend you keep your $22 and save yourself stomach sickness and the chance to renter the '90's.
Skip it. Very minimal selection for dinner and not one thing memorable. Dark and seriously outdated decor. No thank you

We were staying at the Fremont and after a long day of traveling decided not to go far but just have a menu in front of us for choices and skip the monster Buffet as always eat too much at the buffet after all it's an American custom. The menus ok there are plenty of choices, the service is slow comma the food is average , and I sure would like a little better out of Vegas oh well
